With red-berry fruits and light tannins, the wine has spice and crisp edge of acidity that comes from fruit that was just ripe, surprising in the rich 2015 vintage. The wine will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Philippe Pacalet 2013  Echézeaux
description: Structured and still very young, this is a dense and fruity wine. The tannins and the spice and licorice from wood aging show strongly, although they are just beginning to soften and integrate. Expect a rich wine, layered with fruit and ripe tannins as it develops. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Ambe Tour Pourret 2011  Saint-Émilion
description: Rich, spicy and perfumed, this delicious wine is developing well and also has aging potential. It is packed with berry and plum fruits that parade with acidity and tannins that act as a support. It's still dense and the balanced fruit and tannins will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.

title: Robert Perroud 2009 Pollen  (Brouilly)
description: Firm tannins push this wine into the concentrated direction. It is rich, ripe, although with plenty of juicy red fruit flavors. The wine, with its pure line in acidity, has an attractive chewy structure.

title: Herdade da Comporta 2014 Private Selection Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: The wine is soft, smooth and full of rich berry fruits. The blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira and Alicante Bouschet gives a warm southern feel: ripe wine, sunshine and soft tannins. Wood aging has smoothed the bold fruits and created a full generous aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Herdade da Comporta 2014 Private Selection Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: The wine is soft, smooth and full of rich berry fruits. The blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira and Alicante Bouschet gives a warm southern feel: ripe wine, sunshine and soft tannins. Wood aging has smoothed the bold fruits and created a full generous aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Baret 2013  Pessac-Léognan
description: Dense and structured, this ripe and fruity wine features attractive dense tannins that are balanced by rich black-currant fruit flavors. The acidity and the dry core of the wine both promise good aging, so drink from 2020. The property has been in the Ballande family since early 19th century. Red-wine production from the 50 acres is overseen by consultant Denis Dubourdieu.

title: Barton & Guestier 2010 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Some wood aging gives this Merlot-dominated wine a full structure, with attractive tannins and juicy black fruits. It is ripe, full-bodied and very approachable now.

title: Château La Grange Clinet 2010  Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Rich and spicy, this is a smooth, wood-aged wine. It has ripe tannins and some concentrated fruits. With its acidity and dry aftertaste, it will certainly age.

title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2015 Ardósia Tinto Red (Tejo)
description: Made to drink young, this fruity, softly structured wine is ripe with blackberry fruits. There is a touch of spice from the wood aging and a lining of attractive acidity. Drink now.

title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Vosne-Romanée)
description: This has both a rich structure and rich fruit. The tannins comes first, dark and concentrated with spice and a dry core. After it, the ripe and juicy black fruit is layered with dense acidity. Together these two elements make for a concentrated wine that will age. Drink from 2020.

title: Quinta dos Murças 2012 Assobio Red (Douro)
description: From a portion of Esporão's Douro vineyard, this is a smooth, ripe and very accessible wine. Rich, dark plum and berry flavors are given a structure by the wood aging and the firm, mineral tannins. Age this for a year and drink from 2016.

title: Quinta de São Sebastião 2013 Lima Mayer Red (Alentejano)
description: With 12 months oak of aging, this is a rich wine, still showing spice and toast from the wood. That character is finely balanced by the rich black fruit and the acidity. It is a fine wine, ripe and still developing. Drink from 2018.

title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)
description: This is a wood-aged style of Chablis, but the toast has been applied discreetly. Rich, full bodied and structured, this wine is full of ripe yellow-fruit, spice and red apple flavors. Its acidity makes this a juicy expression.

title: Louis Max 2014 Domaine la Marche  (Mercurey)
description: This wine is rich with the sort of firm tannins that will give great supporting structure to the ripe berry fruits. With a juicy character, the wine is fresh and balanced with the solid tannins. It likely will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha Red (Tejo)
description: This is a ripe and spicy wine that is full of dense black fruits. Tannins and spice from wood aging merge with the rich fruit, giving a dry core to the plump, generous wine. It can be drunk now, although the wine will be better from 2017.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Quinta dos Bons Ventos Red (Lisboa)
description: A rich and fruity blend with swathes of ripe red berry fruits that are smoothed out by the soft wood and tannin flavors. Acidity freshens the ripeness. Drink now.

title: Château de Chaintres 2015 Les Sables  (Saumur-Champigny)
description: This is a fine ripe wine. Ripe tannins and attractive red-berry fruits are right up front. A firm dry core suggests it will age although this wine is up for drinking now with its fine balance between acidity, structure and fruit.

title: Domaines Lapalu 2009 La Patache  (Médoc)
description: A rich wine laden with juicy blackberry fruits and wood tannins, lapping up the ripe vintage. Soft and ready to drink.

title: Opta 2016 Red (Dão)
description: Gently wood aged, the wine is rich in tannins and with generous red fruits. It is ripe with pepper as well as red-fruit flavors. It will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Dujac Fils & Pere 2014  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: A fine blend of ripe fruit and crisp red berry flavors, this negociant wine produced by Domaine Dujac is structured and generous. The bright acidity reflects the vintage while the structure and tannins reflect the appellation. Together, they will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Jean-Luc Baldès 2009 Clos Triguedina Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: This is beautifully structured, packed with black fruits, ripe tannins and balanced acidity. It's still young, showing the black fruit side of Malbec, but the tannins are already integrating well into the structure. Age for 4–5 years.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This iconic wine is rich and perfumed. It's powerful and concentrated, with layers of wood contrasted by explosive, ripe fruits. Ripe red-fruit flavors are brightened by ample acidity, resulting in a sumptuous wine that also has enough tannins to age. Drink from 2018.

title: Bernard Magrez 2011 Château du Galan  (Haut-Médoc)
description: This is a ripe and structured wine with great fruit and still some firm tannins. It has layers of black-currant acidity along with the dry core that signal the potential to age further. The blend of 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon gives the wine firmness while allowing plenty of expression for the exuberant fruit. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Vircoulon 2015  Bordeaux
description: This is a ripe wine with generous black fruits and crisp acidity. It is balanced—fruity with a core of tannins. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2007 Les Carruades de Lafite  (Pauillac)
description: Fresh and juicy, with bright acidity and some solid tannins. Flavors of spice accompany an edge of green fruit. The aftertaste is tannins and wood.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2005 Grand'Arte Touriga Nacional (Estremadura)
description: Firm and ripe, with dense, juicy fruit, this shows the exuberant side of Touriga Nacional. It has solid tannins, but the fruit is full of bright berries, herbs and a touch of pepper. The wood aging has rounded the fruit out.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2014 Les Chaniots Premier Cru  (Montagny)
description: This wood-aged wine is rich, spicy and with a stylish combination of acidity and rich yellow and white fruits. The acidity cuts through the ripe texture and gives the wine its full-bodied character. The aftertaste shows a wine that is still young and will be best from 2018.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2014 Les Chaniots Premier Cru  (Montagny)
description: This wood-aged wine is rich, spicy and with a stylish combination of acidity and rich yellow and white fruits. The acidity cuts through the ripe texture and gives the wine its full-bodied character. The aftertaste shows a wine that is still young and will be best from 2018.

title: Château la Voie 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: The wine is structured with firm tannins as well as ripe fruit. Juicy and concentrated, it has a spicy character that comes from the wood aging. In the Mayé Eymery family since 1854, the wine is from six parcels on the estate. Give this fresh as well as rich wine until 2019.

title: Colinas do Douro 2013 Tinto Red (Douro)
description: This is a ripe structured wine. With red fruits, some firm well integrated tannins, it is rich with a strong mineral edge and final acidity. The wine, full of fruit, is ready to drink.

title: Château Vrai Caillou 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: The wine is full of ripe berries, red and black fruit flavors. Soft tannins are a subtext to the main fruitiness. Although the tannins are still dry, they will soften to give a fresh wine that will age quickly. Drink from 2016.

title: Château Hourbanon 2009  Médoc
description: Aging in wood for 18 months has brought out the richness of this generous wine. It has black-currant acidity that is balanced by the tarry tannins and smoky character. Rich and now in equilibrium, this wine is ready to drink.

title: Herdade das Servas 2012 Monte das Servas Escolha Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a warm, ripe and spicy wine. It is full of red fruits, black currant and soft tannins, with great acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Château Labrousse 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Fresh and fruity, Jacques Chardat's wine is packed with red-berry fruit along with a dry core. The tannins and acidity will develop well as the wine ages to produce a ripe, fruity wine. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Les Trois Manoirs 2014  Médoc
description: This is a ripe wood-aged wine. It has tannins and layers of spice and toast from the wood aging. Happily, the fruit is also there, giving well-balanced black currants and acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2013 Carvalhas QV Red (Douro)
description: This wine is made to be enjoyed young and fruity—it is a ripe, generous and full-bodied blend of Douro red grapes. There is a dry edge of tannins which are cushioned by the rich black fruits and lifted by final acidity. Drink now.

title: Herdade Paço do Conde 2012 Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a rich and dense wine, full of dusty tannins and ripe, generous black plum and berry fruits. It's spicy and juicy, with an herbal overtone and a warm, full-bodied character. The wine could do with some aging, so drink from 2016.

title: Labouré-Roi 2014  Savigny-lès-Beaune
description: Typically soft and ripe, this is already a delicious, fruity wine. It is strongly perfumed and has the acidity typical of the vintage. Ripe red fruits and acidity are well balanced, with dry tannins that are still in the background. Drink the wine from 2018.

title: Herdade das Servas 2014 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)
description: Produced in Estremoz by the Serrano Mira family, this rich wine is dense with dark tannins and a powerful structure. This concentration is surrounded by bold ripe berry fruits and acidity that give the wine its richness aided by the wood aging. Drink this finely structured wine from late 2018.

title: Bernard Magrez 2010 Château Gramond  (Haut-Médoc)
description: This is a rich wine still dominated by solid, firm and dry tannins. Its black and red fruits are ripe and juicy, and its freshness comes from acidity that appears on the finish. Age this balanced effort for 4–5 years, at least.

title: Château Reysson 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: This is a bold and rich wine, a blend totally dominated by 90% Merlot. It is fruity, structured and with fine juicy black fruits and acidity. The 12 months of wood aging have given the wine an edge of spice that is attractive now. Final tannins will allow it to age. Drink from 2021

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2012 Léon  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: This is a sweet and fruity wine, full-bodied and ripe. It has red cherries and bananas along with some acidity. While there are some tannins, it's meant for immediate drinking and not for aging,

title: Georges Vigouroux 2010 Cuvée Icône du Château Leret Monpezat Malbec (Cahors)
description: A perfumed wine from new wood aging, powerful extraction and dark tannins. The wine is dense and black in color, heavy on the ripe berry and plum fruits with very firm structure. With its power and youthful fruit, it will age well. Don't drink before 2018.

title: Château de Pizay 2016 Château de Saint Lager  (Brouilly)
description: This wine has a firm structure as well as plenty of fruit. The wine's acidity, crisp red-currant fruit and bright character are balanced by the firm, smoky and dry tannins. Give this structure time to soften and fill out into a ripe wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Château La Grange Clinet 2015  Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Rich, structured and juicy, this wine shows black fruit tones, with its firm tannins and fine acidity. It's developing into a warm, ripe wine. Drink from 2020.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Samora Tinto Red (Tejo)
description: A dark, ripe and fruity wine that is full of dense red-fruit aromas and spicy tannins. The palate offers ample freshness, with crisp, juicy red berry fruit up front. Drink now and until 2017.

title: Domaine Laurens 2013 Cuvée de Flars  (Marcillac)
description: This wine is a vineyard selection, aged in wood for 12 months. A structured blend of Fer Servadou and Cabernet Sauvignon, it has black fruits, firm tannins and acidity, all in balance. The wood aging is only a hint of smoothness with the rich fruit. Drink from 2018.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Monte da Baía Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: This rich, sophisticated wood-aged wine has complex fruits, structure and tannins. Ripe, juicy black fruits are intertwined with a solidly dry texture, powerful but still elegant. It will repay aging. Drink from 2016.

title: Domaine de Bellene 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: Produced from 65-year-old vines, this is a rich and perfumed wine from the estate of Nicolas Potel. It is structured, balancing the red fruits and acidity with a solid framework of tannins. Spice from the wood aging shows lightly, while the wine finishes with crisp red-currant acidity.

title: Domaine de Bellene 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: Produced from 65-year-old vines, this is a rich and perfumed wine from the estate of Nicolas Potel. It is structured, balancing the red fruits and acidity with a solid framework of tannins. Spice from the wood aging shows lightly, while the wine finishes with crisp red-currant acidity.

title: Royal Oporto 2010 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: The texture of this wine is dense and concentrated while keeping the fresh fruit and acidity well in balance. It has ripe blackberry flavors that offer great fruitiness. The firm background of tannin structure is balanced by a juicy, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Royal Oporto 2010 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: The texture of this wine is dense and concentrated while keeping the fresh fruit and acidity well in balance. It has ripe blackberry flavors that offer great fruitiness. The firm background of tannin structure is balanced by a juicy, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château de Rochemorin 2012  Pessac-Léognan
description: Full-bodied herbaceousness is the hallmark of this ripe wine. It offers great acidity while also having rich yellow and grapefruit fruits. Dense with fruits and acidity while also structured, this is a wine to age for a few years. Drink from 2017.

title: Casa S.M. de Tourais 2013 São Matias Red (Dão)
description: This is a lightly textured wine with acidity and some firm tannins. It has a fruity character, red berry flavors and attractive acidity. The wine, balanced and generous, is ready to drink.

title: Cartuxa 2014 EA Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: Rounded, smooth and fruity, this is an attractive wine. With its light texture and acidity that balance the juicy black fruits, it is ripe while also poised. The aftertaste is fresh and fruity.

title: Albert Bichot 2014 Les Sorbets Premier Cru  (Morey-Saint-Denis)
description: Rich, ripe and fruity, this wine wears its tannins easily. With layers of acidity, red-berry fruit and a dark, dry core, the wine is impressive and set to age. The aftertaste is both sweet with the generous fruit and dry with tannins, finishing firmly. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Métairie Neuve 2010  Côtes de Bourg
description: A concentrated wine, it's packed with both dark fruits and tannins. A dense structure contrasts with the fresher black currant fruitiness. Ripe and full-bodied, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2016.

title: Château Roc Meynard 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Ripe, fruity wine, it has sweet tannins, blackberry fruit, laced with acidity. The wine is all fruit, with only the lightest hint of wood.

title: Jaffelin 2010  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: Powerful and finely structured, this rich wine has swathes of red plum and red berry flavors that balance the core of solid tannins. It shows the ripe fruit and structure of the vintage. Age this for 2–3 years.

title: Château Barbé 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Wood spice aromas are an indication this wine that has had serious oak aging. Along with the dense tannins and wood, there is, happily, some fruit that will develop as the structure softens. Drink this powerful wine with its rich berry fruit from 2021.

title: Couly-Dutheil 2010 La Baronnie Madeleine  (Chinon)
description: Ripe, full-bodied and smoky, this is packed with blackberry juiciness. Its structured tannins form a powerful backing to this full and rich character, giving flavors of wood aging, richness and a firm, dry finish. For aging over 3–4 years, while drinkable sooner.

title: Château La Clare 2010  Médoc
description: This is a smooth, balanced wine that shows notes of ripe blackberry and new wood. There is a crisp edge from the currant flavor, and the acidity gives it freshness. Attractive and fruity, this is for aging over the next 3–4 years.

title: Henri Milan 2007 Le Vallon Red (Vin de Table Francais)
description: A rich wine, perfumed and intense. The tannins are a major element, although they ride with the sweet fruit and concentrated, complex wood and acidity. The wine is firm, impressively fruity and still likely to age further.

title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Perescuma Red (Tejo)
description: This is a bold, ripe wine, full of fruit and equally full of dense tannins. A blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon, it is solid, powerful and spicy from wood aging. The structure is still young in this impressive wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Perescuma Red (Tejo)
description: This is a bold, ripe wine, full of fruit and equally full of dense tannins. A blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon, it is solid, powerful and spicy from wood aging. The structure is still young in this impressive wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Clos Salomon 2013 Clos Salomon Premier Cru  (Givry)
description: This rich, creamy, juicy wine is full of strawberry fruits and ripe tannins. It has weight and density as well as powerful structure. A fresh black-cherry character comes through, giving acidity and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2017.

title: Casa da Passarella 2009 O Oenólgo Vinhas Velhas Red (Dão)
description: A superbly ripe wine that is selected from old vines, this is very rich and solidly structured. It has weight and ripe black-fruit notes that are laced with fresh acidity and a jammy plum flavor. It's dark, dense, full of great depth of flavor and worthy of serious aging. Drink from 2017.

title: Wenzel 2006 Rusterberg Pinot Noir (Burgenland)
description: A warm, rich wine, with its red plums, truffle flavors and fresh red fruit acidity. There is wood aging, which has melded well with the fruit, giving a soft, rounded core. The acidity shows well to finish.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2015 Cuvée G Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a superbly rich wine that is packed with generous black fruits and balanced acidity. It has structure and concentrated plum and damson fruits. The wood aging still shows in what is young wine, although this will go. Drink this impressive wine from 2019.

title: Château Brethous 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
description: From organic and biodynamic vineyards, this wine is full of ripe berry fruits backed up by firm tannins, this is a wine that is full of potential. It has structure, a fine form of rich fruit and acidity. With its dense texture this is a wine to age. So just wait until 2019.

title: Espaço Rural 2013 Poento Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: This big, ripe wine is dominated by Alicante Bouschet. Between the tannins and the dense black fruit, the wine is concentrated and generous. Perfumed, full of fruit and a good line of acidity, this rich wine is ready to drink.

title: Espaço Rural 2013 Poento Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: This big, ripe wine is dominated by Alicante Bouschet. Between the tannins and the dense black fruit, the wine is concentrated and generous. Perfumed, full of fruit and a good line of acidity, this rich wine is ready to drink.

title: Château Merlet 2015  Bordeaux
description: Wood aromas and flavors are happily balanced by the ripe berry fruits. So the firm structure is lifted by juicy acidity and fruit to give a wine that will be spicy, fruity and succulent. Drink from 2018.

title: Seguin-Manuel 2014 Les Cent Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: A ripe, juicy and fruity wine, this is rich while shot through with fresh acidity. A dusty smoky structure awaits behind the fruit. It will become a well-balanced wine, packed with fruit and supple tannins. Drink from 2020.

title: Estandon 2016 Lumière de Provence Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: This is a refreshingly fruity wine with a fine balance between acidity and ripe red-currant and raspberry fruits. The wine is crisp, clean and full of fruitiness with a bright fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2014 Clos du Chapitre Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: The fruit and structure of this monopole bottling from Nuiton-Beanoy are already well integrated. With a smoky character from wood aging and a core of firm tannins and acidity, it manages to feel ripe and crisp at the same time. Drink from 2020.

title: Producta Vignobles 2011 Château Courbian  (Médoc)
description: This is well-balanced and ripe, with plenty of room for both the attractive black fruits and the firm tannic structure. Wood aging shows, although it will integrate well. The wine is fruity, likely to be ready to drink from 2016.

title: Florent Descombe 2015  Beaujolais-Villages
description: Ripe, soft and fruity, this is a black-cherry-flavored wine. It has a good balance between the fruit and the crisp acidity, giving a wine that is both rich and bursting with fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Château Landereau 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This fine estate has produced a ripe, fruity wine in 2014. It has spice from wood aging as well as juicy black currant fruit flavors. Generously textured, it's ready to drink.

title: Dão Sul 2011 Casa de Santar Reserva Red (Dão)
description: This is a smooth, ripe and rich wine. It has tannins that give structure and are also well integrated into the generous blackberry and dark plum fruits. The concentration and depth give a solid, dense character. Wood aging, just enough, has smoothed everything out, while the aftertaste brings perfumed acidity at the end. Drink this complex, serious wine from 2018.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2009 Periquita Red (Setubal)
description: This attractive, soft and fresh wine is fruity, with red berry flavors, balanced acidity and warm tannins. With its light touch of spice, it is ready to drink.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2009 Periquita Red (Setubal)
description: This attractive, soft and fresh wine is fruity, with red berry flavors, balanced acidity and warm tannins. With its light touch of spice, it is ready to drink.

title: VIgnobles Ducourt 2015 Château de Beauregard Ducourt  (Bordeaux)
description: This fruity wine is ripe with black fruits and generous tannins. It has plenty of acidity to balance the fruit, giving a wine that is both crisp and packed with fruit. The structure is already just right. Drink from 2018.

title: VIgnobles Ducourt 2015 Château de Beauregard Ducourt  (Bordeaux)
description: This fruity wine is ripe with black fruits and generous tannins. It has plenty of acidity to balance the fruit, giving a wine that is both crisp and packed with fruit. The structure is already just right. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Bélingard 2011 Ortus Red (Côtes de Bergerac)
description: The top cuvée from Bélingard is a rich wine, full of young tannins as well as dense blackberry fruits. It is still very structured, showing its wood aging. The texture will smooth out into a rich, complex wine. Drink from 2017.

title: Pezat 2006  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Fresh ripe black currant fruits are the delicious hallmark of this wine. It is full, rich, juicy, its core of tannins and oak a foil to the freshness and mouthfilling character of the fruit.

title: Château Beynat 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: There is a fine balance between the firm tannins and the ripe fruit in this wine. It has juicy acidity, spice and layers of delicious black-currant flavors. The fourth generation, Nathalie Boyer and Alain Tourenne, converted vines to Ecocert-certified organic beginning in 2008. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta Foz Torto 2013 Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: This wine is spicy with ripe tannins and juicy berry fruits. It is soft and ready to drink with its balanced fruitiness and acidity.

title: Quinta Foz Torto 2013 Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: This wine is spicy with ripe tannins and juicy berry fruits. It is soft and ready to drink with its balanced fruitiness and acidity.

title: Château Liversan 2006  Haut-Médoc
description: Rich and structured, this is a sturdy wine that shows good dry fruit tannins as well as wood. The blackberry fruit is open, ripe, giving a good juicy character and depth of flavor. This is a wine for 2–3 years' aging.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Reserva Tinto Merlot (Tejo)
description: This is a young-colored wine that has been wood aged to smooth out the natural fruitiness of the Merlot. That gives the wine a smoky character with juicy acidity balanced by wood and toast flavors. The black plum flavors are rich, full in the mouth with a dry underlay of tannins. Drink from 2017.

title: Symington Family Estates 2009 Altano Red (Douro)
description: A warm, ripe vintage of Altano, its berry and red plum fruits rich and generous. It has attractive, well-balanced, soft tannins. A layer of acidity and spice completes this harmonious wine.

title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2015 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This perfumed wine is ripe with exuberant black fruit and hints of wood aging. It's juicy with spice and pepper notes as well as bold red fruit. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Méric 2014  Médoc
description: This wine with its tight black-currant character, is still also firm with tannins. It has a juicy edge that will develop well as the wine matures. With crisp acidity and structure, it should age. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Roylland 2007  Saint-Émilion
description: A smooth-textured wine that shows some ripe Merlot, firm fruit tannins and soft spice. There is an edge of wood, but the fruit is bright enough to cope. It should develop well into a rich wine.

title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015 Planchots  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: A ripe, balanced wine that has juicy red strawberry and raspberry fruits and fine acidity to balance. It is warm and rounded, full of dense fruits, with its tannins surrounded by the cushion of the fruit. Drink this already delicious wine from 2021.

title: Château Alta Gaïa 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: There is an attractive 15% Cabernet Franc in this wine. That gives a strongly perfumed character and brings out firm tannins from both the fruit and the wood aging. The wine's blackberry fruits are ripe and juicy with a smooth, rounded aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2011 Bridão Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: Firmly structured, this has both great tannins and equally big, rich berry and black currant fruits that bring the acidity right up front. It is still young, emphasizing the fruit and freshness. The tannins and wood aging flavors need their chance. Drink from 2017.

title: Château Roc de Ségur 2013  Bordeaux
description: This dense, wood-laden wine has ripe spice and dark tannins. It's heavy with wood as well as black currant fruits and acidity. It is young and needs time to integrate, so don't drink before 2016.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015 Merlot (Vin de France)
description: Black fruit and soft tannins yield a wine that is rounded with some attractive texture. Its ripe black currant fruitiness is lifted by its crisp acidity. Drink now.

title: Labouré-Roi 2015  Mâcon-Villages
description: This fruity wine, free from any oak aging, revels in its attractive tropical flavors. It's as ripe and rich as the vintage suggests, with light, balanced acidity. The aftertaste is soft, keeping up the fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2014  Listrac-Médoc
description: The wine is ripe and full of blackberry fruits. It has serious tannins still although these are well balanced by the fruitiness. The firm structure and wood aging flavor will soften over the next few years. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2014  Listrac-Médoc
description: The wine is ripe and full of blackberry fruits. It has serious tannins still although these are well balanced by the fruitiness. The firm structure and wood aging flavor will soften over the next few years. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Tour des Gendres 2015 Tour des Gendres Red (Bergerac)
description: This is a rich dense wine, full of blackberry fruits. With its firm tannins behind ripe fruitiness, it has fresh acidity and layers of wood to give extra density. The wine is still maturing and should be ready from 2018.

title: Château Ladignac 2014  Médoc
description: This is tight, juicy wine produced by the local cooperative. It has intense black-currant acidity and spice and toast from the wood aging. With its tannins it will age. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2013 Dona Matilde Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Red-berry fruits and soft tannins give a wine with some juicy acidity and spice. The firm aftertaste shows that it is still needs time. Drink from 2018.

title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2010 Marias da Malhadinha Red (Alentejano)
description: Ripe and full-bodied, this is a rich and juicy wine. With tannins kept in the background, the front is full of blackberry acidity and jammy fruitiness that's balanced by the fresher black currant aftertaste.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Nana Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: This ripe, spicy wine offers strong wood flavors as well as bold red fruits, accompanied by acidity and rich tannins. Drink now.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Nana Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: This ripe, spicy wine offers strong wood flavors as well as bold red fruits, accompanied by acidity and rich tannins. Drink now.

title: Xavier Flouret 2005 Château Haut-Meneau La Victoire  (Premieres Côtes de Blaye)
description: A firm, ripe wine, with good sweet black currant fruit flavors. It is structured, but mainly showing fruit rather than tannins. There is a fine, fresh finish, hinting at wood.

title: Domaine Dubost 2013 Cuvée Monthieux  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: This rich and full-bodied wine has spice, black fruits and smoky tannins all bundled together into a ripe structure. It's a complex, concentrated wine with finishing acidity that needs to age, so drink from 2015.

title: Jaffelin 2014 Les Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: This will be a delicious, ripe and full wine. Already the red fruits and acidity are filling out the generous space left by the spicy wood. It has dark, smoky tannins and a rich character. Drink from 2019.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2012 Château du Grand Vernay  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: Ripe and delicious, this is full of fruit along with balanced structure. It is lively, with some youthful acidity as well as rich red berry flavors. It's ready to drink now.

title: Château Pilet 2014 Prestige  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: A ripe and rich wine that is structured with tannins and layers of wood. It has spice and black-fruit flavors that make it a rich wine with potential. Drink from 2018.

title: Domaine D'en Ségur 2010 Le Rouge Red (Côtes du Tarn)
description: This Gaillac-like blend of Braucol, Duras and Syrah gives rich fruitiness and soft tannins. The wine is juicy, full of red berry and spice and an attractive light touch. It's ready to drink.

title: Louis Latour 2012  Beaune
description: This is soft and rounded, with attractive red plum and berry fruits that bring in acidity and a light tannic character. The wine is ripe, with a dry core surrounded by cherry flavors and fresh acidity. It is not a wine for long aging, drink from 2017.

title: Château de Parenchère 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: An attractive, caramel- and red-fruit-flavored wine, this has soft tannins and ripe berry notes that are lined with acidity. Not for long aging, it's ready to drink now.

title: Quinta de Porrais 2015 Porrais Red (Douro)
description: The quinta for this wine is on the plateau north of the Douro river. It has produced a red-fruit wine, rich with soft tannins and juicy fruitiness. The wood aging is already well integrated into this bold, ripe wine. Drink now.

title: Château des Jacques 2015  Morgon
description: This is a finely structured wine that will age well. With black-plum fruits, layers of dark young tannins and balanced acidity, it is both juicy and full of great ripe swathes of fruit. From the cru estate that is owned by Louis Jadot in Beaune, it is impressive and worth aging. Drink from 2018.

title: Château de Belcier 2011  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Rich and structured, yet full and concentrated, this wine has both dark tannins and ripe plum and berry fruits. The acidity streaks through the wine, lending freshness and good aging potential. Drink from 2017.

title: Château de Cranne 2015 6ème Génération  (Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This wine is firm and structured. It also has fine black fruit and balanced acidity. Full bodied, fruity and backed by solid tannins. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Puy Marceau 2014  Bordeaux
description: This wine is fresh and juicy with fine tannins and ripe red berries. Owned by the Baylet family, the estate has produced a full and fruity wine. The aftertaste shows acidity and a light spice.

title: Adega Vila Real 2015 Premium Red (Douro)
description: Ripe, spicy and full both of ripe fruits and tannins, this is a full-bodied wine that brings out the minerality and structure of a Douro wine. It has plenty of red fruits to balance these tannins, resolving into the wine that is firm but ready to drink.

title: Domaine Dujac 2009 Les Combottes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: All the proper structure of young Gevrey-Chambertin with the addition of rich, generous fruit. The core is of wood and dry fruit tannins, the fruit of rich black plum juice. At this stage, the wine is firm. Give it 5–6 years to open up.

title: Château de Calavon 2009 Tradition de Calavon Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: An earthy aroma with rich black fruits give a wine that is full-bodied, ripe and soft. It has a warm, juicy character, a dry core surrounded by fresh berry fruits. Not for aging, but open while firm now.

title: Quinta da Pacheca 2013 Colheita Tinto Red (Douro)
description: This ripe, fruity wine has soft tannins and red-berry flavors. With just a touch of spice, it is ready to drink.

title: Adega Mayor 2014 Caiado Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: This rich wine is soft, with generous tannins and ripe fruit. It has a fine, open balance between black fruits and light spice, resulting in a rich wine that is ready to drink now.

title: Château Tayet 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: A ripe wine that has red-berry fruits, slices of black plum and a full deck of tannins. It is concentrated and ripe, full of fruit and equally full of structure. Let the two soften and drink from 2018.

title: Château Tayet 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: A ripe wine that has red-berry fruits, slices of black plum and a full deck of tannins. It is concentrated and ripe, full of fruit and equally full of structure. Let the two soften and drink from 2018.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Rabo de Galo Red (Algarve)
description: This rich wine comes from the far south of Portugal. It is structured and dense with black-plum fruit and firm tannins. Spice and grilled toast from wood aging and acidity gives this wine a good balance as well as ripeness. Drink now.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Rabo de Galo Red (Algarve)
description: This rich wine comes from the far south of Portugal. It is structured and dense with black-plum fruit and firm tannins. Spice and grilled toast from wood aging and acidity gives this wine a good balance as well as ripeness. Drink now.

title: Château de l'Aubrade 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Balanced acidity and fruit give this Lobre wine its immediate attraction. It has a bright character, the fruit and the acidity in harmony. Drink this ripe wine now.

title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2015 Reserva Rosé (Douro)
description: This rosé is a blend of Tinta Roriz and Tinta Francisca. Its wood aging has smoothed out the bright fruit, replacing it with a rich, creamy, warm character. With firm acidity and ripe raspberry touches, it's a full wine that is ready to drink.

title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2015  Sancerre
description: Maturing well, this ripe red-berry flavored wine is soft and rounded. It has just a hint of tannins and wood along with generous ripe fruitiness. The wine is full bodied, likely to be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Domaine Duperray 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)
description: This is a ripe wine, full of cherry fruit and bright acidity. It has a dry edge that gives the wine a structure to balance the crisp, perfumed fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Château Famaey 2011 Cuvée X Malbec (Cahors)
description: This is the big wine from Famaey. Bold, ripe black fruits are rich and generous in character. With a tarry backdrop and some dry tannins from wood aging, the wine is dense, generous and still young. Drink this powerful wine from 2020.

title: Château Tour Saint-Vincent 2010  Médoc
description: A rich and smooth wine, this is packed with black fruits that are touched with smoky tannins from the wood aging. It's full, fruity and structured on the palate. It will age over at least 5–6 years, but, with its rich texture, it will be drinkable soon.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2009 Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This is ripe and jammy, with soft fruit and attractive acidity. It is warm, with a hint of wood aging. Ready to drink.

title: Cortes de Cima 2011 Trincadeira (Alentejano)
description: Full and fruity, this soft, generous wine brings out red berries, ripe tannins and a light touch of acidity. There is a drier core, but the wine is ready to drink, with attractive freshness at the end.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Cigarra Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: A Santos Lima estate-grown blend of Shiraz and Touriga Nacional, this is a ripe, spicy wine that shows its wood aging strongly. Rich tannins and red fruits are melded with acidity and a juicy, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Cigarra Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: A Santos Lima estate-grown blend of Shiraz and Touriga Nacional, this is a ripe, spicy wine that shows its wood aging strongly. Rich tannins and red fruits are melded with acidity and a juicy, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Lima Smith 2013 Boa Vista Touriga Nacional (Douro)
description: A ripe, well-integrated wine, this is both structured and full of fruit. It is rich with perfumed tannins and with black fruits. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Pétrus 2011  Pomerol
description: This extravagantly perfumed wine has great juicy, ripe fruits. The tannic structure is almost secondary in the welter of ripe fruits, but it is enough to promise aging. Acidity and rich fruitiness partner each other to give a wine that is both fresh and powerful. Drink from 2020.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Beaujolais)
description: This is a bright and fruity wine with attractive red-cherry flavors and light tannins. It has crisp acidity and a fresh aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Château Maucaillou 2014  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: A ripe, juicy and smoky wine that is already attractive to drink. It has soft tannins, ripe red berries with acidity and black currants at the end. Drink this fine wine from 2020.

title: Louis Latour 2014  Echézeaux
description: This is a ripe and fruity wine. Soft, generous tannins are embedded in the developing red-fruit flavors. With spice, hints of the wood aging and a rich texture, the wine will develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Roc Taillade 2010  Médoc
description: This ripe, now soft wine has gentle red fruits and soft acidity. It's ready to drink with its rich texture and smooth structure. The end is rounded, only just hinting at tannins.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Andreza Touriga Nacional-Touriga Franca Red (Douro)
description: Ripe and bold, this is a rich wine whose dense fruit is balanced by its equally dense tannins. It has spice, juicy black fruits and a structure that emphasizes minerality and oak aging. It's not quite ready, so drink from 2017.

title: Clos Alivu 2016 Rosé (Patrimonio)
description: This ripe and fruity wine is soft, rich and full of red berry fruit. Its acidity and tangy texture combine with the fruitiness to give a full, smooth-textured sip. Drink now.

title: Château du Vieux Puit 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Packed with spicy black fruit, this is a solid, dense wine. It has acidity and a crisp edge, although this is more than balanced by the ripe black plum flavors and generous tannins. Drink from 2019.

title: Taylor Fladgate 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: Ripe and fruity, this is a rich, smoothly textured wine. It has dense blackberry fruit flavors, smooth tannins and just a light touch of acidity. Raspberry jelly and a touch of tannic structure at the end, give a fresh taste.

title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2014 Red (Alentejano)
description: This smooth ripe wine is ready to drink. Its black fruits and soft tannins go well with the juicy flavors and fine acidity. Generous and with a warm, rich character.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Fonte do Beco Castelão (Setubal)
description: Soft, ripe, juicy wine, full of bright red berry fruits, soft tannins and a light structure. The wine is ready to drink, the final flavor lifted by acidity.

title: Château Saint-Sernin 2010 Prestige Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: This is a rich and structured wine from Heifara Swatvagher. With wood aging giving the wine its toasty, spicy character, it is ripe and perfumed with black plum flavors and fresh with black currant acidity. The wine is only just beginning to be ready to drink and will certainly be better from 2018.

title: Château Le Crock 2012  Saint-Estèphe
description: Owned by the Cuveliers who also own Léoville Poyferré in Saint-Julien, Le Crock in 2012 is a powerhouse of ripe tannins and juicy acidity. It's a wine that demands aging with its tannins and still-youthful fruitiness. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta do Filoco 2014 Filoco Tinto Red (Douro)
description: This wine is rich, full of fruit and with a medium-term potential. Attractive berry flavors are ripe and full of juicy acidity. Drink this lively, fruity wine from 2018.

title: Adega Mãe 2012 Dory Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: With winemakers Anselmo Mendes and Diogo Lopes, there is a good pedigree to this wine. It shows in the dark tannins, the rich fruit and the concentrated structure. The wine is rich with great power although that is mitigated by the acidity and fresh aftertaste. The wine is, of course, still young and should be drunk from 2020.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 F'oz Red (Alentejano)
description: A warm, southern feeling wine, it has herbs, spice and rich tannins as well as a crisper feel of acidity. Fruity, full of black currant and red berry fruits, forward and ripe. It's not for aging.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 F'oz Red (Alentejano)
description: A warm, southern feeling wine, it has herbs, spice and rich tannins as well as a crisper feel of acidity. Fruity, full of black currant and red berry fruits, forward and ripe. It's not for aging.

title: Pierre André 2012  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: With yellow fruit flavors and soft acidity, it's rich and fragrant. The wood aging shows at the end, along with some ripe pear flavors. Drink now.

title: Monte Branco 2010 Alento Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a concentrated, extracted wine, packed with black fruits and firm tannins. As a reserva, it is constructed for aging, both sweetly fruity and darkly structured. It has all the richness of Alentejano fruit, while still keeping some acidity and freshness to finish.

title: Hafner 2011 Classique Zweigelt (Burgenland)
description: This ripe, juicy wine has flavors of spice and black cherry, along with soft tannins. Fruity and ready to drink, it has a bright line of acidity.

title: Camille Giroud 2008 Charmes Chambertin  (Charmes-Chambertin)
description: A solid structure and layers of dense fruit characterize this wine. Rich acidity, red cherry flavor and a dry, dark tannic core are surrounded by juicy red berry fruits and the freshest finish.

title: Château Preuillac 2011  Médoc
description: A strong Merlot element has produced a ripe, juicy wine, full of fruit balanced with a subtle use of wood. It's a powerful, concentrated wine that has impressive tannins, rich berry fruits and acidity. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Cantin 2013  Saint-Émilion
description: Dark in color, this wine is firm, structured and dense. Ripe blackberry fruits dominate the tannins, giving weight and impressive richness for the vintage. The wood-aging is still showing in the dry core, so the wine needs to age. Drink from 2018.

title: Alente 2013 Red (Alentejo)
description: A smooth and rounded blend of Trincadeira and Aragonez, this is rich, soft and full in the mouth. Red berry fruits dominate this wood-aged wine, allowing spice and acidity to give a generous aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château des Landes 2012 Cuvée Tradition  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)
description: Dominated by 80% Merlot, this ripe and firm wine is full of red berry fruits with a solid, dry core that comes from the fruit tannins. The tannins are still young, still solid, so the wine even with its fruitiness needs to age. Drink from 2016.

title: Château Clos Chaumont 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
description: The wine suffers from over-ripe fruit that give it a red-jelly flavor. The tannins and acidity make an odd contrast.

title: Alex Gambal 2014 Les Enseignères  (Chassagne-Montrachet)
description: Packed with both wood and ripe fruit, this rich wine is full of juicy citrus and spice flavors that are lifted by the steely acidity and crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2017.

title: Chateau de Launay 2011 Château Dubory  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: There is fine acidity here, black currant fruit and firm tannins. The combination works well, giving fruitiness and structure. The result is a wine with aging potential, freshness and an attractive, juicy aftertaste.

title: Domaine de Suremain 2015 En Sazenay Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
description: This is a perfumed wine, opulent and with a fine smoky structure. With great ripe berry and red-currant fruit, the wine has a juicy character, bright and crisp with acidity while also solidly textured. Drink this wine from 2023.

title: Château la Gaffelière 2015 Dame Gaffelière  (Saint-Émilion)
description: The second wine of this Premier Grand Cru Classé estate is very fine. With its rich tannins, generous acidity and black fruits, it is solid and dense while having such attractive fruitiness. The wine will age well, full of ripe fruit and with excellent concentration. Drink from 2021.

title: Laurent Gauthier 2015 Grand Cras  (Morgon)
description: Volcanic ash over granite gives this vineyard its structured character, which carries over into this wine. Wood aged in large barrels, it has a rich firm character that will allow the wine to develop. Powered by acidity and tannins, the ripe black fruits are juicy and concentrated. Drink this wine from 2018.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2011  Marsannay
description: A dark-hued wine, it's richly fruity with spice and wood flavors. It is ripe, full in the mouth, offering solid tannins as well as attractive acidity. It's suited for medium-term aging, so drink from 2016.

title: Clos des Rocs 2015 En Chantone  (Pouilly-Loché)
description: Full of warm fruit and light spice, this generous wine is rich with yellow fruits balanced by bright acidity and vanilla. The rounded texture and ripe fruit mean the wine is very ready to drink.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Quinta das Amoras Reserva Branco White (Lisboa)
description: This is a rich, wood-aged wine with spice, apricot and ripe plum fruits and a mineral texture. It is rounded as well as fresh, crisp with acidity while full in fruits. Drink this delicious wine now.

title: Château Bélingard 2012 Réserve Red (Côtes de Bergerac)
description: This ripe, fruity and structured wine is still young and the tannins need time to round out. However, it is already rich, with juicy red fruits and a core of fragrant acidity. The wine is dense and worth aging. Drink from 2017.

title: Dão Sul 2006 Monte da Cal Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a perfumed wine that has just pure berry fruits, red plums and spice from tannins. There's no wood aging here, but the wine succeeds because of its delicious ripe fruits and balancing sweet acidity.

title: Château Baracan 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
description: The wine has fine, juicy fruit over smooth tannins. Its smoky flavors, touches of wood aging and rich tannic structure are integrating well. It will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Red (Alentejano)
description: This rich blend of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro is all fruit without any oak aging. That gives the wine a ripe black-fruit character, balanced with acidity and a light touch of spice. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Domaine Berthoumieu 2013 Charles de Batz Tannat-Cabernet (Madiran)
description: Of course, this 90% Tannat wine is still very young. But it's impressive, rich and concentrated and promises to age well. It is dense with both tannins and fruit, black plum and berry flavors dominating, cut by acidity. It will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Berthoumieu 2013 Charles de Batz Tannat-Cabernet (Madiran)
description: Of course, this 90% Tannat wine is still very young. But it's impressive, rich and concentrated and promises to age well. It is dense with both tannins and fruit, black plum and berry flavors dominating, cut by acidity. It will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Château Haut la Pointe 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Spice and red berry aromas are followed by red currant fruit flavors, layers of tannins and juicy acidity. It has made the most of the ripe fruitiness of the vintage and will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Roquevale 2010 Tinto da Talha Grade Escolha Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a rich blend of Aragonez and Touriga Nacional that fills out broad black fruit and acidity with soft tannins and a ripe texture. Rich and juicy, it's ready to drink.

title: Domaine Vacheron 2015  Sancerre
description: Expanding on their fathers' legacies, the cousins Jean-Laurent and Jean-Dominique Vacheron have a deserving reputation for their almost-Burgundian Sancerre. This latest vintage, packed with both fruit and structure, shows why. It is ripe with red cherries and dark plums laced with acidity. The wine is full of great ripe fruit and generous tannins. Drink from 2018.

title: Domaine Vacheron 2015  Sancerre
description: Expanding on their fathers' legacies, the cousins Jean-Laurent and Jean-Dominique Vacheron have a deserving reputation for their almost-Burgundian Sancerre. This latest vintage, packed with both fruit and structure, shows why. It is ripe with red cherries and dark plums laced with acidity. The wine is full of great ripe fruit and generous tannins. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Escot 2012  Médoc
description: This is a ripe wine that also has a light touch. That gives black-currant fruit and tannins along with a poised structure and attractive crisp acidity. The Cabernet Sauvignon fruit dominates while also giving the wine a dry core. Drink this stylish wine from 2019.

title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2014 Monsaraz Tinto Red (Alentejo)
description: This soft, ripe and fruity blend of local grapes is young and spicy. It has flavors of ripe red fruits that are cut with juicy acidity. It's a fresh wine that is ready to drink.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Casa do Lago Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: With its dark color and rich fruit, this is instantly approachable. Tannins are well integrated into the ripe plum and black cherry fruits. With fresh acidity and a core of dry tannins at the end, the wine could age. Drink from 2016.

title: Domaine du Moulin 2012 Vieilles Vignes Red (Gaillac)
description: With Merlot softening the power of Brau-col, this is a full-bodied while rounded wine. Juicy acidity gives a fresh character, and red berry fruits dominate the firm tannins. Balanced and concentrated, it will repay some good aging. Drink from 2017.

title: Domaine du Moulin 2012 Vieilles Vignes Red (Gaillac)
description: With Merlot softening the power of Brau-col, this is a full-bodied while rounded wine. Juicy acidity gives a fresh character, and red berry fruits dominate the firm tannins. Balanced and concentrated, it will repay some good aging. Drink from 2017.

title: Pezat 2010  Bordeaux
description: A juicy, fruity wine with attractive, bright red-berry fruit flavors. The wine is fresh, touched nicely by some wood and tannins.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Cassa Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This is a ripe wine with its juicy black fruits and generous tannins. It has a mature character that's emphasized by the wood aging and rich fruitiness. There's a touch of pepper at the end from the alcohol which is a shame. Drink now.

title: Château la Gordonne 2010 Verité du Terroir Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: This ripe wine has jammy red fruit flavors. The fruitiness is given structure by the stalky tannins and the dry, wood-aging flavors. Black cherries and juicy black currants show strongly. It needs to age, so drink from 2016.

title: Albert Bichot 2014 Les Amoureuses Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)
description: Ripe and generous, this floral wine is dense with fruit as much as tannins. It is full of blackberry and plum flavors, ripe while also cut with acidity. The spice that comes from the wood aging shows well, adding a further element. Drink the wine from 2022.

title: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2014 Malbec (Cahors)
description: This wine, with its black fruits and still-firm tannins, is crisp with intense acidity as well as black-currant fruitiness. Its ripe structure suggests the ability to age a little longer, and the wine will be best from 2018.

title: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2014 Malbec (Cahors)
description: This wine, with its black fruits and still-firm tannins, is crisp with intense acidity as well as black-currant fruitiness. Its ripe structure suggests the ability to age a little longer, and the wine will be best from 2018.

title: Château Certan de May de Certan 2014  Pomerol
description: This is a big wine in its breadth of flavors and structure. Powerful tannins give hints of the wood aging. The ripe black fruit is given a crisp edge by the acidity that is typical of the vintage. The wine will certainly age well. Drink from 2023.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Coeur de Presse  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: Only the juice at the heart of the pressing is used to make this attractive and ripely fruity wine. It has a soft, full texture with juicy acidity and generous tannins. The wine is dense, packed with red plum and berry flavors and finished with just the right, fresh acidity. Drink now.

title: Casa Ferreirinha 2015 Esteva Red (Douro)
description: This wine is ripe, fruity and balanced. It has red-berry flavors along with acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2019

title: Colinas do Douro 2015 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: The wine has 12 months of aging to give it extra richness and a ripe full texture. It does have firm tannins although these are already embedded in the rich black fruits. The Douro minerality shows through the texture and acidity at the end. This wine deserves some aging: drink from 2019.

title: Schröder & Schÿler 2012 Private Réserve  (Médoc)
description: A blend created for Schröder & Schÿler, a Bordeaux wine merchant founded in 1739, this is soft, ripe with plenty of red berry fruits. It has some firm tannins still although these are rounded out with the juicy fruits and final acidity. It's an attractive wine to drink now.

title: Château Lanbersac 2009  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion
description: This is a firm yet ripe wine that boasts ripe black-plum flavors layered with dense and dusty tannins. The wine is concentrated, with wood aging filling out the structure. It is big and bold, finishing with great ripe fruit.

title: Château Roque le Mayne 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This ripe, smoky wine is structured, full of new oak flavors and dense with both fruit and tannins. Its concentrated, bold blackberry flavors and firm tannins mix with smoky wood notes and acidity. Drink from 2020.

title: Clos Troteligotte 2014 K-Or Malbec (Cahors)
description: Always a dense and concentrated wine, this new vintage also reveal rich fruit, blackberry and plum. Combined with dark tannins and layers of spice from wood aging, it's a structured wine that finishes with fresh, fruity acidity. Drink from 2018.

title: Fleury 2012 Ilixens  (Bordeaux)
description: A soft, perfumed wine, it shows attractive light black currant flavors as well as some tannins, acidity and a young fruity character. It is ready to drink now.

title: Quinta da Romaneira 2011 Red (Douro)
description: A solid, firm wine with a great rapport between the black berry fruits, juicy acidity and dark tannins. It has a fresh element along with a powerful structure and dense mineral texture. It will age well, so drink from 2017.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Valcatrina by Santos Lima Red (Alentejano)
description: A brief period of wood aging delivers soft tannins and juicy blackberry fruits to this ripe wine. A streak of acidity gives the powerful wine a crisp edge. Drink now.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2008 AB Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)
description: A fine example of this sometimes tricky grape, this wine is structured with solid tannins and rich fruit. Wood aging has softened some of the structure, allowing a more rounded, rich aftertaste.

title: Château Teyssier 2014  Saint-Émilion
description: This is a delicious wine with its ripe fruits and soft tannins. It has a touch of spice, as well as bright acidity along with a touch of smokiness from the wood aging. Rich and generous, it will mature quickly. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Laronde Desormes 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: With firm tannins as well as juicy black-currants, this is an attractive wine. It has plenty of acidity which is balanced by the ripe fruitiness. Drink from 2018.

title: Domaines Devillard 2011 Clos du Cellier aux Moines Premier Cru  (Givry)
description: The vineyards of the 13th century abbey of La Ferté produces some of the best Givry. This wine has great structure with firm tannins, and also rich, juicy fruitiness that offers delicious acidity and a more solid base for aging. Drink from 2016.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Monte Velho Red (Alentejano)
description: This fruity red wine is one of Portugal's best sellers. Along with its red fruit and attractive acidity it is soft with just an edge of tannins. Drink this young wine now.

title: Domaine des Sabines 2014  Lalande de Pomerol
description: Packed with ripe Merlot fruit, this is a dense wine. It has impressive structure and great acidity to cut through the dark fruit. Rich and full in the mouth, this will be a solid fine wine from 2020.

title: Château Le Cap 2015 Excellence  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This wine is juicy and fruity, with generous tannins that support its ripe black fruit and balanced acidity. It has a smoky edge and will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Sanguinhal 2009 Quinta do Sanguinhal Red (Obidos)
description: A ripe and structured wine, this is full in the mouth and rich with blackberry fruit. The tannins are firm while also finely integrated into the generous fruitiness. The wine is mature and ready to drink with a juicy aftertaste.

title: Sanguinhal 2009 Quinta do Sanguinhal Red (Obidos)
description: A ripe and structured wine, this is full in the mouth and rich with blackberry fruit. The tannins are firm while also finely integrated into the generous fruitiness. The wine is mature and ready to drink with a juicy aftertaste.

title: Château Magondeau 2012  Fronsac
description: This ripe, Merlot-dominated wine offers bold tannins and black plum-skin fruitiness. It has spice, toastiness from wood aging and the potential of a ripe and generous character. It is firm at this stage and needs to age, so drink from 2017.

title: Château Magondeau 2012  Fronsac
description: This ripe, Merlot-dominated wine offers bold tannins and black plum-skin fruitiness. It has spice, toastiness from wood aging and the potential of a ripe and generous character. It is firm at this stage and needs to age, so drink from 2017.

title: Louis Jadot 2009  Corton-Charlemagne
description: A hugely rich, powerful Chardonnay, layering ripe fruit with a core of tannic structure, acidity, wood and huge depth of flavor. The wine is concentrated, with layers of fruit and textured acidity. Of course, it needs aging—7 years at least.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Valcatrina Red (Alentejano)
description: A rich red from the warm south of Portugal, the wine is soft, spicy and juicy. It has some oak aging that shows through the ripe red-berry fruits. The tannins are soft, just giving shape to the open, rich fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Quinta da Beira 2014 Faisão Red (Dão)
description: Ripe, balanced and attractive, this red boasts fine tannins that lend subtle structure to the black plum fruit. Dense with fruitiness and acidity, it's rich enough to savor with meat. Drink now.

title: Nelson Neves 2012 Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Generous, fruity and rich, this ripe wine has black chocolate flavors to go with its soft tannins and rounded structure. At the end, acidity gives freshness and blackberry-jelly sweetness.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013  Charmes-Chambertin
description: Powerful and structured, this wine is dark with black fruits. The rich fruit and acidity are surrounded by firm tannins provide a solid scaffolding. With acidity and tannins at the end, this complex wine will age slowly, so don't drink before 2022.

title: Château Tour de Lagarde 2009  Saint-Émilion
description: Big, dense wine, with dusty tannins and ripe red plum fruits. The wine is concentrated, fruity while also structured. It is already balanced, the acidity giving freshness, the texture showing the delicious ripe character of the vintage.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2004 Adegaborba.pt Reserva Red (Alentejo)
description: A ripe, smooth wine, dominated by juicy Trincadeira that has been tamed by 12 months wood aging. There's great spice, toast, dark berry fruits and good concentration. The tannins and the fine acidity promise aging potential.

title: Château Gamage 2011 Selection Exceptionelle  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Ripe fruit suggests a wine that is soft, juicy and unlikely to age for long. It has red berry flavors, attractive tannins and fine finishing acidity.

title: Wachter Wiesler 2010 Pfarrweingarten Blaufränkisch (Eisenberg)
description: From the south of Burgenland, this is a big, fruity wine. Wood aging shows in its toastiness, but there are prominent red fruits, a dry edge of tannins, and some good acidity as well. The structure is firm and solid with good depth and dense texture. Drink this wine from 2014.

title: Castello d'Alba 2008 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Wood-aged wine that shows pedigree and style. It has red berry fruit flavors, firm tannins along with acidity and a dry core. It's a serious wine, for aging over 4–5 years.

title: Château Tour Bayard 2014  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Full of bright black-currant fruit, this wine shows its young fruitiness, backed by a dry core of tannins and ample acidity. With its structure and spicy wood flavors, it will develop into a complex, dense wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Casca Wines 2010 Santos da Casa Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Long wood aging and a selection of grapes from old vines have produced this firmly structured and concentrated wine. It is full of black plum-jelly flavors shot through with acidity. A solid, dry core promises even further aging. At the end, acidity gives a juicy, delicious aftertaste. Drink from 2017.

title: Vignobles K 2014 Badine de la Patache  (Pomerol)
description: The wine, with its firm tannins and solid structure, is still young. The hints of black-plum fruits are way behind the structure. That's all good, because this wine will come together well, to give a rich full wine with spice, juicy black fruits and acidity. Drink from 2020.

title: Vignobles K 2014 Badine de la Patache  (Pomerol)
description: The wine, with its firm tannins and solid structure, is still young. The hints of black-plum fruits are way behind the structure. That's all good, because this wine will come together well, to give a rich full wine with spice, juicy black fruits and acidity. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Mayne Vieil 2013 Cuvée Aliénor  (Fronsac)
description: While this wine is concentrated with firm tannins, the rich fruit dominates. It is dark, complex and rich, filled with black-plum flavors and a good structure. Intense juiciness character complements the tannins, giving a ripe wine that can age. Drink from 2018.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: This wine is firm and structured, with complex tannins and dark black-fruit flavors. Under the tannins, juicy fruit with considerable acidity gives signs of great potential. The aftertaste again comes back to the structure. Drink from 2019.

title: Gernot and Heike Heinrich 2010 Red Red (Austria)
description: A blend of Austrian red varieties, this is soft, light and fruity. It has flavors of red fruit and spice from wood aging. With its attractive acidity, this is ready to drink. Screwcap.

title: Château Bardins 2011  Pessac-Léognan
description: With a high proportion (60%) of Merlot, this is a ripe wine while also being structured. It has a dense character that comes from the still young, firm tannins. Behind these are the ripest black-currant fruits, crisp and juicy, packed with flavor as well as acidity. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Les Frères Perroud 2013 Améthyste  (Brouilly)
description: With a year's age, this wine has softened its intense fruitiness and ripened with a rich, soft texture and well-integrated acidity. A structure gives a dry edge to the red currant and cherry fruits that are rounded out with a perfumed aftertaste.

title: Château la Mascaronne 2009 La Mascaronne Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: Rich and dense, this is a ripe, wood-aged wine, now showing maturity. It has weight, red berry fruits and a firmer structure of tannins. It is ready to drink, but could age another year.

title: Vignerons de Buzet 2012 Oniric Cabernet Sauvignon (Buzet)
description: Darkly colored, this comes from the slopes above the small town of Buzet. It has structure and layers of black currant fruit and juicy acidity. With its firm tannins and ripe fruitiness, the wine will age. Drink from 2016.

title: Château des Judes 2016  Bordeaux
description: Still showing its wood aging, the wine is rich with spice and blackberry fruit. It is structured and with swathes of juicy fruitiness. The acidity at the end gives this wine its final lift.

title: Campolargo 2013 Os Corvos Red (Bairrada)
description: This is a ripe, juicy and accessible wine. Full of blackberries, soft tannins and with balanced acidity, the wine is more about fruit than structure. It is ready to drink.

title: Niepoort 2009 Batuta Red (Douro)
description: Dark in color, this is a powerful, classic wine, with dense tannins. It has rich black-fruit flavors, and notes of wood and herb that are packed into its concentrated, dry structure. This is a great Douro for aging.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Domaine de la Madonne des Loges  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: This ripe wine has a full-bodied character that is then cut with acidity. It's juicy and fruity, with a good depth of flavor. The texture is firm, still young and needing until 2015 to age.

title: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2014 Concerto  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: One of two wines produced by this estate from old vines, this is a ripe, full wine that has a fine balance between ripe red-berry fruit and acidity. Spice from the wood aging gives an extra complexity to what is already a delicious wine. Drink from 2017.

title: Domaine d'Escausses 2014 Cuvée des Drilles Red (Gaillac)
description: This predominately Duras wine is fresh and fruity with an attractive depth of smoky tannins and structure. It is rich enough to age although its red currant fruitiness is delicious and juicy now. Drink now, or age until 2018.

title: Domaine d'Escausses 2014 Cuvée des Drilles Red (Gaillac)
description: This predominately Duras wine is fresh and fruity with an attractive depth of smoky tannins and structure. It is rich enough to age although its red currant fruitiness is delicious and juicy now. Drink now, or age until 2018.

title: Château de Chénas 2015  Moulin-à-Vent
description: Produced from vines that are up to 40 years old, this is a firmly structured wine. Concentration and dry tannins come from some firm extraction. The fruit though is ripe and juicy, showing red-berry flavors along with spice from the wood aging. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Quinta de Lemos 2010 Alfrocheiro (Dão)
description: This is an aromatic wine, one of a series of four wines featuring the major red grapes of the Dão. It is ripe, fruity with soft tannins and juicy acidity. Red berry fruit and a balanced structure give a fragrant wine that is ready to drink.

title: Caves Velhas 2013 Cabeça de Toiro Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: This blend of Castelão and Touriga Nacional is well balanced. Spice from wood aging for nine months mingles with the ripe black-currant fruits. A firm wine with rich fruitiness, it's ready to drink.

title: Château Moulin de Guiet 2015  Côtes de Bourg
description: Ripe and soft, this is a smooth, dense wine. Yes, it has plenty of tannins, but they're smothered by the concentrated black fruit that gives it its generous, rich character. It's likely to age well, so drink from 2020.

title: Château Saint-Didier-Parnac 2016 Château de Grézels Prestige Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: This wine is very young, with its bright purple color, spice and wood aromas and firm texture. Although the wood is still integrating, its ripe blackberry fruit and rich texture show it has great potential and needs to age. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2014  Pessac-Léognan
description: A tightly coiled rich wine that has great acidity as well as a lively structure. Touched by spice from wood aging as well as intense citrus, it is fruity, firm and strongly textured. Drink this impressive still-young wine from 2022.

title: Clos Beauregard 2014  Pomerol
description: Produced from 40-year-old vines on a 15-acre vineyard, the wine is almost entirely Merlot. It has dense, dark tannins and signs of wood aging that will integrate with time. It is a very fine, rich wine with black-plum fruit flavors. The aftertaste brings out the acidity and black currant fruits.

title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 Mariana Rosé (Alentejano)
description: Ripe and fruity, this is a rich style of rosé. A blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, it is full of ripe raspberry and red plum flavors that are soft and generous, although lacking acidity. Drink now.

title: Château La Roche Bazin 2011  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: A rich, bold wine full of wood flavors that are already well integrated with the ripe fruit and solid tannins. The wine is dense, while having a surface polish of smooth fruitiness. Give the wine 3–5 years.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Andreza Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This is a seriously impressive, ripe and powerful wine. Boasting rich fruits, black plum and berry flavors and concentrated acidity, it also has a dark, solid structure. Still young, this shows boisterous acidity and needs to soften and fill out further. Drink this fine wine from 2018.

title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Vale da Poupa Field Blend Red (Douro)
description: This is a rich, smooth wine with balanced black fruit flavors and a solid layer of tannins. It is ripe with juicy fruit and cool acidity. The wine is delicious, ready to drink now.

title: Herdade dos Machados 2013 Santos Jorge Red (Alentejo)
description: Dry and stalky, this wine from the eastern Alentejo is structured and firm. It has ripe black fruit flavors along with acidity, both of them dominated by tannins from the fruit. The wine needs to age; drink from 2017.

title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2005 Cister da Ribeira Red (Douro)
description: A ripe, soft wine that represents great drinking value. The fruit is fresh and easy, with light tannins and acidity. This is juicy, full of red fruits and touched by a light element of wood.

title: Domaine d'Alzipratu 2015 Pumonte White
description: This ripe wine offers yellow fruit and a generous texture. A touch of pepper accompanies the acidity, fruits and full-bodied structure. Drink this rich wine from 2017.

title: Château Saint-Didier-Parnac 2016 Prieuré de Cénac Malbec (Cahors)
description: This wine comes from a selection of parcels on the plateau above the Lot river in Cahors. It's rich and firm, with great wood and spice notes as well as exuberant black plum and berry fruit. With its acidity, still-young tannins and firm texture, it will age. Drink from 2020.

title: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2010 Concerto  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: A firm and concentrated wine that reveals its fruit and structure gently. It has a solid texture, dark tannins and a smoky, wood-laden character. Red fruits and balanced acidity dominate the aftertaste. This fine wine is ready to drink and until 2018.

title: Château Terres Douces 2014  Bordeaux
description: This is a fruity wine, full of red-berry flavors and with some smoky tannins in the background. It is balanced between the wood aging and the berry and red-cherry fruitiness. Drink from 2017.

title: Château l'Orangerie 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Reflecting the ripe vintage, this is a warm wine. Its black currant fruit is still dominated by spice from wood aging, although this will dissipate to leave a smooth, ripe and fruity wine. Drink from 2018.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Monte Alentejano Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: Ripe and generous, this is a rich, full-bodied wine. While there are still young tannins, the wine is more about rich black fruits, dark plum skins and final acidity. It needs some more time, so drink from 2016.

title: Casal da Coelheira 2013 Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: Structured and ripe with black fruits, this wine has some firm tannins along with rich, spicy flavors and acidity. The wine was fermented in open tanks a technique that gives an extra richness and color to the wine. Wood aging has added a final, smoothing touch.

title: Château du Bernat 2014  Bordeaux
description: The wine is ripe with attractive acidity. It has plenty of red fruit, a smoky tannic structure and a perfumed aftertaste. With the fruit ready to burst through the tannins, it will be ready to drink from 2017.

title: Clos Larcis 2009  Saint-Émilion
description: Rich, concentrated wine, with generous fruits and soft tannins. It has super-ripe black plums, a touch of chocolate and spice from wood aging. Powerful, juicy, fruity, likely to age well over the medium-term, over the next 3–4 years.

title: Château Haut-Brion 2014  Pessac-Léognan
description: With seriously dense tannins, this shows great structure. Rich and full of ripe fruit, it also has a fresh streak that gives it a lift. The structure will allow the wine to age over many years while the fruit and acidity will give it crispness. Drink this impressive wine from 2027.

title: Château Julian 2010  Bordeaux
description: Full of spicy wood flavors, this wine also has black currant fruit flavors and considerable acidity. It's well-balanced, fresh while also ripe and fruity. Drink soon.

title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)
description: This is no basic white Burgundy. With balanced wood aging and ripe fruit, it is rich and full in the mouth. It has tense acidity as well as an almost honeyed character. The wood fits well into this wine along with final acidity. It is ready to drink.

title: La Chablisienne 2012 Les Preuses Grand Cru  (Chablis)
description: A touch of spice and vanilla from wood aging is balanced by ripe yellow fruits and honey. This wine is freshened by lime-juice acidity that gives a crisp texture.
