description: Rich and spicy, this 90% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon from 10 acres generous and ripe, with warm tannins and a fruity, red berry character. This blend has attractive acidity and spicy flavors from the combination of wood and stainless-steel aging. This is only the second vintage from enologist Jean-Rémi Larrat's own property. It is worth aging, so drink from 2017.

title: Olivier Leflaive 2012  Meursault
description: This full-bodied wine has swathes of ripe yellow fruits and juicy wood and acidity. Under this opulent surface, a more steely character gives the wine structure that will allow it to age. It will be ready to drink by 2016.

title: Taylor Fladgate 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: This is an ripe and fruity LBV that is bottled ready to drink. With black currant fruits that are sustained by acidity as well as structured tannins, the wine is fruity as well as rich and concentrated. It has a reminiscence of the perfumed character that is typical of Taylor Fladgate Vintage Ports while being more immediately approachable. Drink now.

title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 Monte das Amforas by Quinta do Carmo Red (Alentejano)
description: Produced at Quinta do Carmo, this easy and ripe wine is totally ready to drink. With bright red-berry acidity and soft tannins, the blend of Aragonez and Trincadeira is all fruit, finished with acidity.

title: Enoport 2014 Penina Red (Tejo)
description: A soft wine that has ripe red fruits and gentle tannins. Ready to drink immediately, it is fruity with spice, black cherry and acidity all in balance.

title: Château de Piote 2011 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: With some good concentration and hints of the wood aging, this ripe, full wine has both fruit and tannins. A stalky, black currant element adds texture as well as a fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2016.

title: Château la Valière 2014  Médoc
description: The wine is rich and packed with ripe black fruits. The firm tannins are comfortably cushioned by the ripe texture. This is young, although developing well. Drink this wine, with its fine potential, from 2019.

title: Le Carré 2013  Saint-Émilion
description: Ripe and powerfully structured, this is dense with bold blackberry flavors and dark tannins that give a firm structure. However, as so often with 2013, it's the fruit that shines in this rich wine. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2015 Cuvée Les Tourelles  (Bordeaux)
description: The wine has structure along with juicy generous fruits. Bright fruitiness brings acidity from black-currant flavors. Drink this ripe wine from 2018.

title: Château Reysson 2011  Haut-Médoc
description: Rich already, this wine is darkly tannic and powered by solid tannins. The weight of fruit behind the tannins also brings out acidity and black currant flavors. It will remain dry but well structured and with good fruitiness. Drink from 2017.

title: Caves Velhas 2014 Casaleiro Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: A ripe, smooth wine that has black fruits over generous tannins. The perfumed Syrah and Touriga Nacional in the blend give the wine structure and fine black currant fruits. The aftertaste brings out the acidity and tighter texture. Drink now.

title: Domaine Roger Champault 2014 Les Pierris  (Sancerre)
description: With its origins in the 17th century, this estate has 50 acres. This red with its ripe tannins and juicy red-berry fruits has the weight to give richness as well as fruit. A good structure supports the fruit while remaining discretely in the background. Drink now.

title: Château Roc de Boissac 2014  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion
description: Toast and blackberry aromas set the scene for this ripe, bold, fruity wine. With tannins, spice from wood-aging and a still-firm texture, it's showing its youth, but the rich blackberry fruit and density promise long life ahead. Drink from 2020.

title: Campolargo 2011 Rol de Coisas Antigas Red (Bairrada)
description: This is a big, perfumed wine. It is still young, with new wood flavors, touches of eucalyptus and dense, dry tannins. To balance all this structure, the ripe and juicy berry flavors give the wine the richness it needs. Drink from 2017.

title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2015 Duras-Braucol Red (Gaillac)
description: This wine brings together the two native grapes of Gaillac in one ripe, light and fruity whole. It has soft tannins and fine juicy acidity. There is a youthful rusticity to the wine and a crisp bright red-fruit aftertaste. Drink from 2018.

title: Château La Caussade 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Full of red fruits as well as spicy wood flavors, this is a rich wine that has a fine concentrated texture. It is firm at the moment, showing layers of toast and wood from a year in oak barrels. Allow the ripe fruit to come through and drink from 2019.

title: Château La Caussade 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Full of red fruits as well as spicy wood flavors, this is a rich wine that has a fine concentrated texture. It is firm at the moment, showing layers of toast and wood from a year in oak barrels. Allow the ripe fruit to come through and drink from 2019.

title: Château Pavie Macquin 2009  Saint-Émilion
description: Very fruity aromas hint that this is a bright wine, its tannins shaded by the red and black berry flavors. The structure is integrated, showing ripe as well as fresh fruit with final flavors of chocolate.

title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2011 Avidagos Red (Douro)
description: This is ripe and fruity, a wine that is smooth while still structured. Firm tannins are filled out with juicy red berry fruits and freshened with acidity. It's  already drinkable, although it will certainly be better from 2016.

title: Château Haut Mazerolles 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This is a concentrated wine that is structured and packed with red fruits and solid tannins. It feels weighty and rich; the juicy character is balanced by a firm, dry texture. For aging over several years.

title: Domaine les Capréoles 2015 Chamodère  (Régnié)
description: A soft and fruity wine that has lively acidity and light tannins. The wine is finely balanced, full of red-cherry flavors. It's an immediately attractive, ripe cru wine that is ready to drink.

title: Château Fourchou 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Dark in color, this wine from the Entre-deux-Mers shows structure, firm black fruits and rich tannins. Berry fruits, black currants, smokiness and fresh acidity are well integrated and balanced with the firmer texture. It will certainly age, so drink from 2015.

title: Château des Jacques 2010 Clos du Grand Carquelin  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: A finely perfumed wine, touched with wood, Beaujolais in a Burgundy style, structured and with intense acidity. It is packed with firm tannins, surrounded by a lively cherry and rich fruit character.

title: Château de Lisennes 2014 Cuvée Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Red-currant fruit flavors shine through this light fresh wine. Although there are tannins, it is more about the crisp fruits and acidity. Drink this from 2018.

title: Domaine d'Alzipratu 2014 Pumonte Red
description: This wood-aged wine is ripe with black fruits and dense with dark tannins. It has a warm feel to its structure, developing into a concentrated, black-plum-flavored wine backed by toast and firm tannins. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Maison Blanche 2010  Médoc
description: While this shows its youthful tannins, it also bears blackberry fruit and juicy acidity. The chateau has produced a stylish wine that's rich while still keeping plenty of freshness and acidity. Age for 3–4 years.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Domaine des Trois Vallons  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: Ripe cherries dominate this rounded, full-in-the-mouth wine. An attractive smoky character enhances the red fruits and balanced acidity. The wine is developing, still young and fruity and bright with freshness at the end.

title: Goulée 2014 Goulée de Cos d'Estournel  (Médoc)
description: A smooth and ripe wine produced by the team of Cos d'Estournel. It is full and rich with black-plum fruits and velvet tannins. With fine acidity at the back, it has kept its freshness. Drink from 2022.

title: Goulée 2014 Goulée de Cos d'Estournel  (Médoc)
description: A smooth and ripe wine produced by the team of Cos d'Estournel. It is full and rich with black-plum fruits and velvet tannins. With fine acidity at the back, it has kept its freshness. Drink from 2022.

title: Quinta do Vallado 2014 Touriga Nacional (Douro)
description: At the western edge of the main Port vineyards, this estate is as well placed for fine wine as for Port. This richly structured Touriga Nacional has attractive acidity, perfumed black fruit and robust, tight tannins. With its wood aging, it's made to age. Drink from 2021.

title: Quinta do Vallado 2014 Touriga Nacional (Douro)
description: At the western edge of the main Port vineyards, this estate is as well placed for fine wine as for Port. This richly structured Touriga Nacional has attractive acidity, perfumed black fruit and robust, tight tannins. With its wood aging, it's made to age. Drink from 2021.

title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: A structured wine that is also full of ripe fruit. Its red-berry fruits are encased in the tannins that still need to soften. The wine will be generous, full of berry flavors and with a dense texture. Drink this big wine from 2024.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Château des Vierres  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: This fruity and juicy wine has red-berry flavors and fresh acidity. The fruit from this single vineyard gives concentration and some firm tannins as well as allowing a fresher side to sing out. Drink now.

title: Château Rocher Calon 2011  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Ripe and fruity, this is already a delicious wine. It has blackberry fruit, sweet tannins and acidity that percolates through the ripe texture. Generous and open, it is almost ready to drink.

title: Vieil Armand 2009 Château Ollwiller Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Light in color, this is a soft, red fruited wine. It has red cherry flavors with a dry edge of fruit tannin and wood. The acidity and the juicy aftertaste give a really attractive finish.

title: Terra Silvestre 2015 Private Selection Red (Tejo)
description: Still with its firm tannins intact, the wine needs to age. It is dense and dry while showing the juiciness of Alicante Bouschet. As it develops, it will become rich, full and packed with mature fruit. Drink from 2019.

title: Caminhos Cruzados 2014 Titular Colheita Red (Dão)
description: This is a soft style of Dão, focusing on fruit rather than structure. That gives ripe black-cherry flavors, acidity and a warm open texture. Made from a blend of all the local red grapes, it is rich and ready to drink.

title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Lisboa)
description: Syrah, Castelão and Aragonez go into the blend of this rich juicy wine. It is so soft and ripe, just hinting at tannins and with red-berry fruit. The wine is round and smooth, ready to drink.

title: Roux Père et Fils 2007 Les Valozières  (Aloxe-Corton)
description: A very structured wine that seems ready for aging. Its tannins are still firmly present, lying over the dark black fruit. Acidity gives the wine a rich, juicy finish.

title: Château Fongalan 2010  Côtes de Bourg
description: The wine is rich and still shows firm tannins, along with full-bodied blackberry fruitiness and a tight, crisp texture. It's solid and concentrated, full of juiciness at the end. Drink from 2016.

title: Doudet Naudin 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: The Savigny-lès-Beaune-based producer shows his Pinot Noir skills with this wine. It's generous, with red plum flavor, light wood-aging notes, ripe tannins and crisp acidity. It's rounded and ready to drink.

title: Alex Gambal 2013  Bourgogne
description: The fruit in this soft wine is ripe and creamy. Green and white fruits give a balanced blend of fresh acidity and smooth texture. It is rich, generous and will be ready to drink from 2016.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Fonte do Beco Castelão (Península de Setúbal)
description: The full juiciness of Castelão is balanced by spice and structure from wood maturation. The result is a smooth, textured wine, firm with tannins for aging. It is rich, smoky, dry and edgy at this young stage. Drink from 2016.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Fonte do Beco Castelão (Península de Setúbal)
description: The full juiciness of Castelão is balanced by spice and structure from wood maturation. The result is a smooth, textured wine, firm with tannins for aging. It is rich, smoky, dry and edgy at this young stage. Drink from 2016.

title: Domaine de la Pepière 2012 Clisson  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine Clisson)
description: Made for aging, this wine is structured and firm. It has a dense texture surrounded by ripe white and yellow fruits. With a touch of spice and a pepper character, it is rich, impressive and full-bodied. Drink from 2017.

title: Quinta das Marias 2015 Alfrocheiro (Dão)
description: The grape that is very local to the Dão region has produced a dense rich wine that is full of fruit. Black currants and berries shine through the firm texture and the solid tannins. The aftertaste has tangy minerality and plenty of acidity, both good for aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Roncão 2014 DR Colheita Red (Douro)
description: This wine is ripe and rich, with fine tannins and structure. Great swathes of blackberry fruits come with a mineral edge and some tight tannins. Give this balanced wine until 2019.

title: Roncão 2014 DR Colheita Red (Douro)
description: This wine is ripe and rich, with fine tannins and structure. Great swathes of blackberry fruits come with a mineral edge and some tight tannins. Give this balanced wine until 2019.

title: Quinta do Pinto 2012 Pinto Merlot-Syrah (Lisboa)
description: A ripe and juicy wine, this is rich with black fruits. Soft tannins and a stalky backdrop make it very approachable when young. So drink this full fruity wine now.

title: Falua 2015 Tagus Creek Shiraz-Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)
description: An open, ripe and fruity wine made to be drunk young, this has black currant and spice flavors, plenty of acidity to keep it crisp and balanced tannins. The aftertaste is bright and lively.

title: Château Saint-Pierre 2007  Saint-Julien
description: Impressively ripe fruit, with smoky flavors from wood, the texture sweet and fleshy. The wine has juicy berry flavors, with the freshest acidity, livened with spice from the fruit and the oak aging. Worth aging for 5–10 years.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Colleja Red (Douro)
description: This is a rich, full and structured wine with a great balance between black fruit and tannins. It shows the stony minerality of the Douro, with generous fruit and acidity. Drink from 2018.

title: David Duband 2014 Les Sentiers Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)
description: This wine manages to combine firm structure with the finely perfumed fruit associated with Chambolle-Musigny. It's rich, fruity, lifted by acidity and held together by solid tannins. Impressive and full bodied, it's a wine to age. Drink from 2024.

title: Perescuma 2015 Orquestra Red (Alentejano)
description: With pictures of violinists, this is obviously a musician's wine. The wine is soft, full of red berry fruits, and attractive bursts of acidity. Drink this crisp wine from 2017.

title: Domaine Rotier 2013 Esquisse Red (Gaillac)
description: This fresh, young and fruity wine is made to be drunk young. It has soft tannins and intense acidity, mitigated by the ripe, red fruits and smoky aftertaste.

title: Domaine Rotier 2013 Esquisse Red (Gaillac)
description: This fresh, young and fruity wine is made to be drunk young. It has soft tannins and intense acidity, mitigated by the ripe, red fruits and smoky aftertaste.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2014 Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This monopole vineyard came into the Bouchard family in 1791, 60 years after the maison was founded. This wine is smoky and full of fruit and sweet tannins. With its balanced tannins and rich fruits, it is developing well. The dense structure behind the fruit promises good aging. Drink from 2020.

title: Casca Wines 2010 Monte Cascas Grande Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: From selected grapes, this concentrated wine is dense and still needs aging. It has layers of wood over dark, brooding black fruits and a powerful structure of smoky toast and tannins. Big, rich and with great potential, it should be drunk from 2016.

title: Château de la Chaize 2015  Brouilly
description: The wine is fruity, bright and with cherry flavors. With its soft tannins and juicy acidity, it is a cru wine to drink young. The aftertaste is all fruit.

title: Casca Wines 2010 Santos da Casa Grande Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: Big, rich fruits dominate this impressive wine that also has a concentrated structure of tannins that give power. Full of rich Alicante Bouschet, it is a warm, ripe and rounded wine that still could age. Drink from 2017.

title: Duorum 2014 Colheita Red (Douro)
description: Balanced, ripe and structured, this is a fine reflection of the minerality that comes from Douro vineyards. It has firm tannins along with perfumed berry fruit and bright acidity. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2017.

title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Castelo do Sulco Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: The red wine is rich, dense and packed with fruit and tannins. It comes from the heart of the Lisboa region, giving plenty of structure from the cool-climate vineyards. There are fine red-fruit flavors shot through by juicy acidity. The wine has a drier, still developing tannic aftertaste. Drink from 2017.

title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Red (Lisboa)
description: A blend of Syrah, Castelão and Aragonez, this is a ripe, full wine that has fine soft fruit. The tannins give just the right edge to the red fruits and final acidity. Drink now.

title: Producteurs Plaimont 2014 La Madeleine de Saint-Mont  (Saint-Mont)
description: From a small parcel of 19th-century vines planted on the hill of Saint-Mont, this is a finely structured rich wine. It has dark tannins and dense black fruits that are balanced by acidity. Rich, spicy and full, it still has tannins that will begin to soften shortly. Drink from 2018 until 2024.

title: Georges Vigouroux 2010 Château Tournelles Red (Buzet)
description: The small enclave of Buzet makes wines in a Bordeaux style, with black currant fruitiness and some firm tannins. This wine, now aging well, shows ripe juicy fruits, a solid dry core and refreshing, crisp acidity at the end.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Andreza Reserva  Red (Douro)
description: A smooth, rich wine whose fruit is ripe, full of blackberry flavors and perfumed acidity. It also has weight, concentration and a tight mineral edge that gives it extra complexity. The wine is fruity and ready to drink.

title: Grand Bateau 2016 Sécret de Grand Bateau  (Bordeaux)
description: Soft, ripe, red fruit-flavored Merlot gives a round character to this rich wine. It has plenty of spice, juicy acidity and gentle tannins that make it drinkable young.

title: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Porca de Murça Tinto Red (Douro)
description: A ripe red-fruit flavored wine that comes from the Douro village of Murça. It has light tannins as well as red-berry fruits and balanced acidity. There is a mineral textured touch at the end.

title: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2009 Thélème  (Chinon)
description: The great 2009 vintage in the Loire has produced a rich wine, the wood flavors balancing with the full black plum fruit. There is a toasty character that acts as a counterpoint. Along with the acidity, the flavors suggest a wine for aging over 2–3 years.

title: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2010 L'Extase Red (Côtes de Bergerac)
description: This is a dark purple colored wine, packed with tannins that come both from the rich fruit and new wood used in aging. It's still a young wine with black fruits showing strongly through the structure. Powerful and concentrated, it will age well over many years.

title: Ribafreixo 2014 Pato Frio Grand Escolha Antão Vaz (Alentejano)
description: After aging in bottle, this wood-aged wine has smoothed out to produce a rich wine with balanced fruit, acidity and toastiness. The wine does have plenty of spice from the wood, but it also has layers of citrus and pear-fruit flavors. Drink this wine now.

title: Château les Conseillans 2015 Réserve du Pré carré  (Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This rich, ripe and generous wine is full of blackberry fruit and tannin. It's powerful, with a solid structure and fine fruitiness. As a result, it has good aging potential, so drink from 2020.

title: Pinhal da Torre 2010 Quinta do Alqueve Tradicional Red (Tejo)
description: A ripe, juicy and fruity wine that has attractive black currant aromas, lively acidity on the palate and a light, bright feel. With open berry fruits, this wine is ready to drink.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine Montchavy  (Morgon)
description: Dark-hued wine, dominated by acidity as well as firm tannins. It shows solid, chunky structure, ripe fruit and plenty of sweetness. Of course, there is acidity as well, the charm of Gamay coming through in the fresh cherry flavors. Age 2–3 years.

title: Poças 2011 Vintage  (Port)
description: Very rich and deliciously smooth, but with a bite of acidity and stalky black-currant fruit to give it structure. This wine is dry, ripe and dense, showing its tannins while promising longevity.

title: Duorum 2015 Reserva Old Vines Red (Douro)
description: Concentrated tannins and rich black plum and currant flavors distinguish this serious, dense wine. It has structure and dry tannins resulting from both the old vine fruit and the barrel aging. This is a wine that deserves some good aging. Drink from 2020.

title: Roche de Bellene 2011  Bonnes-Mares
description: This wine has great power along with magnificently rich fruit. Wood aging provides a judicious support to its fullness and opulence. Acidity, black cherries and red berry fruits come together with firm tannins. Combined they are already in balance, but the wine needs to wait. Drink from 2018.

title: Sylvaine et Alain Normand 2016  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse
description: Ripe fruit aromas show alongside an equally rich, creamy palate. This wine has attractive lemon and crisp apple flavors, touched by wood to give a smooth, rich aftertaste. Drink from 2018.

title: Sylvaine et Alain Normand 2016  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse
description: Ripe fruit aromas show alongside an equally rich, creamy palate. This wine has attractive lemon and crisp apple flavors, touched by wood to give a smooth, rich aftertaste. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Léon 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This is balanced and ripe with some firm tannins and spice. The blackberry fruit has a stalky character with plenty of acidity as well as a dry core of tannin. The wine will develop well over the next few years to create a ripe and gently structured wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Galès 2012  Graves
description: Aged for a year in wood, this dense, structured wine has serious tannins that are still very firm. Hints of juicy red currant fruits underneath promise a fresh, fruity wine with time. Drink this wine from 2017.

title: Jaffelin 2010  Beaujolais-Villages
description: There is some of the structure characteristic of 2010 Beaujolais in this wine, but it is mainly dominated by a red cherry flavor and fresh acidity. It's ripe, fruity and ready to drink.

title: Henri de Villamont 2010 Blagny Premier Cru  (Meursault)
description: This big, ripe and fruity wine shows both the richness and the structure of the vintage, but never loses sight of balance. It's full of rich yellow fruits, green plums and citrus, but structured with refreshing acidity, a minerally texture and gentle hints of wood aging. Drink from 2015.

title: Château Franc-Cardinal 2005  Bordeaux Côtes de Francs
description: Dark colored wine, with ripe black plum flavors that lie over solidly textured tannins. Structured to bring out the fruit, the wine also has a core of wood, spice, dark cocoa and black currant acidity to finish. An attractive wine that is worth aging for another two years.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Vinha da Defesa Red (Alentejano)
description: Putting Syrah and Touriga Nacional together is a popular blend in Alentejo, producing structured wines that also exude ripe berry fruitiness and a fine aromatic character. This wine is still young as its firm tannins are evident even as its fruit is well in place, fresh and fruity and with a rich aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.

title: Domaine Faiveley 2011 Les Cazetiers Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: This finely made wine has weight and firm tannins, along with intense acidity. Faiveley owns 12 acres of this premier cru which produces structured wines with fruit tannins and smoky fruit. At the end, the wood aging gives a burnt edge that needs to soften. Drink from 2017.

title: Château Lamothe 2015  Bordeaux
description: Touches of wood meet with ripe tannins and acidity. Black-currant flavors, spice and toast are balanced with acidity and a finish that brings in black-cherry fruits. Drink from 2018.

title: Château de Calavon 2010 Tradition Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This is a rich and perfumed wine that is solid with dusty tannins and ripe fruit. Bold acidity adds balance and promises good aging. It is quite dry with fruit hiding behind all the structure, but it will soften, so drink from 2016.

title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2014 CV Curriculum Vitae Red (Douro)
description: Young and with great potential., this is a powerful, firmly tannic wine, full of wood-aging flavors. It is The dark tannins are lifted by a juicy edge that will be attractive as the wine develops although the wood needs time to soften. Drink from 2021.

title: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2011 Les Terres Noires  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: Just beginning to mature, this generous wine has fine red berry fruits, a smoky character, touches of wood aging and further potential. It shows acidity with a juicy red cherry aftertaste. Drink now and until 2019.

title: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2011 Les Terres Noires  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: Just beginning to mature, this generous wine has fine red berry fruits, a smoky character, touches of wood aging and further potential. It shows acidity with a juicy red cherry aftertaste. Drink now and until 2019.

title: Château de Santenay 2015 Les Pruliers Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: There is a fine perfumed character with this wine. It floats above the ripe cherry and berry fruits and the firm structure of rich tannins. The vineyard, centrally located in Nuits-Saint-Georges, has given a firm wine with the great potential to be generous. Drink from 2021.

title: Garriotin 2009 Malbec (Cahors)
description: A ripe and fruity wine, with berry fruits, some spice and smooth tannins. The structure is buried within the fruit, soft and ready to drink.

title: Münzenrieder 2008 Mavie Red (Burgenland)
description: A blend of Zweigelt and Bordeaux grapes, this is rich and spicy with black plum fruit and soft tannins. Acidity cuts through the opulent feel. It is juicy, ripe and ready to drink now.

title: Château la Tour de Bessan 2008  Margaux
description: From one of the properties controlled by Marie-Laure Lurton, this is a finely made wine. It revels in its structure, while around that there are ripe, soft red berry fruits, spice and an intensely juicy acidity. Full of charm, ready to age.

title: Luis Duarte 2015 Rubrica Branco White (Alentejano)
description: A straw-colored wine, this was aged in wood and is full of spice as well as fruit. Centered on Antão Vaz and Verdelho, it has acidity, apricot and citrus flavors and good acidity. Beautifully structured, it's rich while still firm and restrained. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Haut Sociondo 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This is a ripe, spicy and full-bodied wine from the Robin group of producers created by Grand Moulin's Jean-Francois Renaud in Blaye. The wine has both structure and rich blackberry fruit. The tannins are dusty, spicy and with fine acidity to balance. Drink this fine wine from 2019.

title: Château Haut Sociondo 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This is a ripe, spicy and full-bodied wine from the Robin group of producers created by Grand Moulin's Jean-Francois Renaud in Blaye. The wine has both structure and rich blackberry fruit. The tannins are dusty, spicy and with fine acidity to balance. Drink this fine wine from 2019.

title: Château Bélingard 2005 Ortus Red (Côtes de Bergerac)
description: From selected parcels of the Bélingard vineyard, this is a firm and rich wine, with excellent concentration. The tannins are firm, dusty, broken by ripe plums and sweet acidity. The 18 months of wood aging shows in the polish of the wine. Age for another year.

title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2012 Clavis Aurea Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: This is a ripe, smooth, gently tannic wine. It is dominated by rich red berry fruits, black plum skins that are balanced by a light layer of wood aging that adds some spice. It is sophisticated, structured and ready to age for a few years. Drink from 2017.

title: Luis Duarte 2011 Rubrica Red (Alentejano)
description: One of Portugal's top reds, this is a richly endowed wine. Ripe fruits are cut with fresh acidity, dark tannins and signs of judicious wood aging. It shows elegance, style and a rich aftertaste. Drink this great wine from 2018.

title: Château Tassin 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Soft, ripe and fruity, this lightly spicy wine is full of red fruits and crisp acidity. It balances between the fruit and the tangy, textured aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Churchill's 2015 Quinta da Gricha Vintage  (Port)
description: Ripe, fruity and balanced, this has the potential to be a delicious, not-too-concentrated wine. Acidity and some dry tannins give the wine a firm character that is balanced by the fragrant berry fruits. Drink from 2026.

title: Domaine Jacourette 2015 L'Ange et Luce Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: From vines not far from Mont Sainte-Victoire, this fruity wine is full on the palate. A touch of spice accompanies the ripe strawberry flavors. It's rich with a soft aftertaste and light acidity.

title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2011 Les Perrières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
description: One of the most familiar of Puligny's Premier Crus has produced a ripe, yet very structured wine. It has intense minerality and a nervy, tight texture balanced with acidity, crisp apple and attractive wood spice. Everything is in harmony on this complex wine, promising a smooth aging . Drink from 2016.

title: Campolargo 2012 Entre II Santos Red (Bairrada)
description: This light and fruity wine has 80% Baga in its blend. It is juicy, full of acidity and bright with red-berry fruitiness. The wine is immediately attractive and ready to drink.

title: Evening Land 2011 Château de Bligny  (Côte de Nuits-Villages)
description: Lightly tannic and attractively fruity, it's ready to drink. It has a soft structure, red fruits and a finish that is full of bright acidity.

title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)
description: One of the star grapes of the Alentejo, this is a ripe, full-bodied and deliciously juicy wine. Almost black in color, it is packed with tannins, spice, intense acidity and a fine structure. It could do with some aging, so drink from 2016.

title: Companhia das Quintas 2003 Quinta do Cardo Special Selection Touriga Nacional (Beira Interior)
description: Ripe, smooth, velvet textured wine, layering dark chocolate, black plum skins, dense tannins and a big, solid structure. It tastes powerful from the ripe tannins and big fruit, finishing with fresh acidity.

title: Château Mayne Vieil 2014  Fronsac
description: With ripe Merlot dominating this fine, blackberry flavored wine, it is fruity and rich. The acidity gives a crisper edge to the wine while the tannins come from a dry core. It is a wine in progress, full of potential and likely to be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2013 Les Villots  (Sancerre)
description: Ripe, soft red cherry fruits are linked to a light texture and soft tannins in this ready-to-drink wine. The final acidity brings out the attractive fruitiness of this fresh wine. Drink now.

title: Niepoort 2008 Quinta da Pisca Vintage  (Port)
description: Fine grain tannins, with an aroma of light smoke and tobacco over juicy, soft fruit. It has great structure, with a firm core, round and fruity. Well balanced, it suggests aging possibilities.

title: Château Eugénie 2011 Tradition Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: The wine is driven by its full and rich red fruits. The tannins are smooth, given a polish by the wood aging. It's structured, firm and ready to drink, with a solid future until 2020.

title: Domaine de Bel Air 2015 Les Burdelines  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Jean-Marc Lafont's 2.8 acres of sandstone soil in this area of Moulin-à-Vent has produced a ripe, solidly structured wine. Wood aged and with a rich, tight texture and firm tannins, it is a cru wine to age. It is a bold ripe wine, ready to drink from 2019.

title: Domaine de Bel Air 2015 Les Burdelines  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Jean-Marc Lafont's 2.8 acres of sandstone soil in this area of Moulin-à-Vent has produced a ripe, solidly structured wine. Wood aged and with a rich, tight texture and firm tannins, it is a cru wine to age. It is a bold ripe wine, ready to drink from 2019.

title: Famille Laplace 2016 Aramis Tannat-Syrah (Vin de France)
description: Red berry aromas and spicy fruit give a wine that is ripe and smooth, with just the lightest of tannins. It's all fruit—juicy and open. Drink now.

title: Quinta de São José 2014 Red (Douro)
description: Ripe and rich, this has blackberry fruit and well-integrated tannins. A year's wood aging has given it structure and concentration. The wine will mature well and gently. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Acker-Perreau 2010  Bordeaux
description: This is a fruity, ready-to-drink wine, with acidity cutting through the juicy black currant fruits. This is attractive and bright, yet structured.

title: Robert Perroud 2014 En Saburin Cuvée Romain  (Brouilly)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, the wine is soft, ripe and full of fruit. Red cherries dominate, with a touch of wood from the 12 months of barrel aging. It has a bright, crisp and juicy aftertaste.

title: Robert Perroud 2014 En Saburin Cuvée Romain  (Brouilly)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, the wine is soft, ripe and full of fruit. Red cherries dominate, with a touch of wood from the 12 months of barrel aging. It has a bright, crisp and juicy aftertaste.

title: Real Companhia Velha 2008 Porca de Murça Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Red fruits dominate a wine that is rich, full-bodied with a firm, tight structure. Round the firm texture there is a richer, ripe fruit character, dense and juicy. The wine can be aged, but it is ready to drink.

title: Croft 2015 Quinta da Roeda  (Port)
description: Beautifully perfumed, this is a ripe and structured wine. It has fine dusty tannins, intense blackberry fruits and a dark-licorice aftertaste. Acidity keeps the wine fruity and fresh although with those firm tannins, it will need time. Drink from 2027.

title: Manuel Olivier 2012  Meursault
description: A ripe wine, this is full in the mouth and full of fruit. Apricots and lemons go well together for a rich while crisp mouthful. The wood aging over 18 months only shows fleetingly, leaving fruit as the main thrust. It finishes with plenty of fresh acidity. Drink from 2016.

title: Château Saint-Sernin 2009 Malbec (Cahors)
description: With its new wood and mint flavors, this is a smooth, polished wine, full of delicious ripe black fruit flavors and acidity. The wine is elegant, the wood already well integrated into the fruit. Age for 3–4 years.

title: Château de Nardon 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Ripe and fruity, this is a wine made for drinking soon. It has ripe black-plum fruit, structured tannins and a juicy and smoky character that is already delicious.

title: Château d'Aydie 2012 Madiran Laplace Tannat (Madiran)
description: At the hands of Pierre Laplace, Tannat becomes smooth, rounded and shapely. It of course has tannins, but these are at the service of the rich fruit and the balanced acidity. The wine is full of character, a medley of fruit along with an elegant structure. It's going to develop well, so drink from 2018.

title: Rozes 2013 Terras do Grifo Red (Douro)
description: This attractive wine is full of ripe fruit, with soft tannins and only light acidity. It is developing well. Drink this wine from late 2017.

title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2014 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: From vines in the north of the Nuits Saint-Georges, close to Vosne-Romanée, this is a structured wine. It has ripe berry fruits and acidity that are still developing through the firm, dry tannins. The wine is still young and needs to age, so drink from 2019.

title: Château de Fuissé 2012 Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Dominated at this young stage by wood, this is a potentially rich and creamy wine. Its structure shines through, full and generous. The fruits and the acidity still have to develop, but already the wine is showing the rounded character of a great Pouilly Fuissé. It's a wine to age, so drink from 2016.

title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2011 Cuvée Signature  (Clos de la Roche)
description: This is an attractive, fast-maturing wine with soft tannins, ripe fruits and a juicy, perfumed acidity. It has considerable weight and concentration, along with firm red-plum and berry flavors. It's an elegant wine that should be drunk from 2017.

title: Trenel Fils 2015  Fleurie
description: This is a complex cru wine that has ripe fruits, firm tannins and a good ageworthy structure. It has a dense texture, rich black-cherry fruits and a finish that brings out crisp acidity. Produced by this Beaujolais-based negociant, the wine will be ready to drink from the end of 2017.

title: Château Bélingard 2010 Red (Bergerac)
description: Structured and firm, this is a solid, chunky wine. With its black fruit flavors merging with a more dry and tannic core, it is both dense and ageworthy. Acidity leavens its rich character. Age for 3–4 years.

title: Château Hourtin-Ducasse 2013  Haut-Médoc
description: This smooth wine has a good balance between a dry core and black currant fruit. It has a fresh character, typical of the vintage, along with acidity and smokiness from the wood aging. It will not age long, drink from 2017.

title: Château Saint Seurin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: There is a caramel edge to this wine showing the wood-aging flavors. Luckily the fruit is all there as well, giving a balanced future to this structured wine. With plenty of tannins and juicy acidity combined, it will be a fine wine from 2019.

title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: A smoky spicy wine that is full of berry fruits and with some toasty wood-aging flavors. With its tannic structure it will need to age, although already the bright berry fruits are generous and ripe. Drink from 2022.

title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 Automne Festif  (Fleurie)
description: Firm tannins show the structure and density of this wine. Dark plum fruits give a concentrated character that is cut by red-cherry acidity. Big and bold, this ripe while fresh wine needs to age. Drink from 2017.

title: Dürnberg 2012 Bodenschatz Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)
description: Fruity black currant aromas leap out of the glass in this wine, offering flavors that are fresh, young and fruity. It has soft tannins, cherry fruit and lively acidity. Not made for aging so drink now. Screwcap.

title: Fontes da Cunha 2015 Mondeco Branco White (Dão)
description: A blend of Encruzado and Gouveio, this is a soft, creamy and fruity wine. It has no wood aging, emphasizing the ripe apricot and pear fruits. The aftertaste is crisp and bright.

title: Louis Jadot 2012  Bourgogne
description: This soft, smooth and creamy wine has attractive spice and vanilla from the wood aging, along with light citrus and peach flavors. Ripe and full in the mouth, it has a touch of minerality at the end to give a fine texture. It is ready to drink.

title: Jean-Paul Brun 2015 Pisse Vieille  (Brouilly)
description: This is a ripe, soft and rich cru wine. With its attractive cherries and gentle tannic structure, it is fruity and easy. The acidity that comes through at the end gives the wine a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Tussock Jumper 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This fruity red wine has firm tannins and juicy acidity. Its soft, rounded aftertaste makes it easy and warm.

title: Château Cambon la Pelouse 2008  Haut-Médoc
description: With hints of mint, and a firm structure from wood as well as tannins, this is a flattering wine. The tannins are rich, layered within the jammy black berry fruits. This is a wine for aging, but is deceptively attractive now.

title: Domaine Labruyère 2014 Coeur de Terroirs  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: This is a rich cru wine with red-plum flavors as well as tannins that are still young and forceful. Densely textured, the wine has plenty of potential. It will become a ripe and fruity wine while also remaining firm and structured. Drink from 2018.

title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 La Chenevière  (Morgon)
description: Ripe and juicy, this is a warm, red-fruited wine. With plenty of acidity, it is fresh, although the big attraction here is the fresh fruit balanced by the firm, smoky tannins. Drink from summer 2016.

title: Caves Aliança 2008 T Quinta da Terrugem Red (Alentejo)
description: Firm and structured, this is a densely rich wine for aging. Firm tannins dominate its ripe black fruit, lending notes of spice, licorice and toast from the wood. It needs several years of aging to round out—give it four years at least.

title: Dão Sul 2012 Quinta do Encontro Q do E Red (Bairrada)
description: Baga has been softened by Merlot to produce a rounded wine, with accents of spice and generous tannins. Berry fruits come strongly through the dry core, giving a rich character to the wine. The finish is full of acidity and ripe red fruits.

title: Famille Laplace 2015 Aydie L'Origine Tannat-Cabernet Franc (Madiran)
description: This ripe, balanced wine is structured and packed with fruit. The firm tannins of Tannat are given a perfumed lift by Cabernet Franc, filling the palate with blackberry fruit and fine, balanced acidity. It's still young and bursting with fruit, ready to drink from 2018.

title: Château Franc Pipeau 2012  Saint-Émilion
description: A well constructed, solid wine, this has a fine layer of firm tannins that melds well with the rich black plums and acidity. Even this young, the wine is showing a balanced character, warm and ripe. It will age, so drink from 2018.

title: Château Franc Pipeau 2012  Saint-Émilion
description: A well constructed, solid wine, this has a fine layer of firm tannins that melds well with the rich black plums and acidity. Even this young, the wine is showing a balanced character, warm and ripe. It will age, so drink from 2018.

title: Thorin 2014 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)
description: With its joyous red color and ripe fruits, this is a balanced and lively wine. It is fresh but has a light structured character, full of cherry fruit flavors and fresh acidity at the end.

title: Joseph Drouhin 2012 Petit Monts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)
description: Big and bold with great strawberry and red cherry flavors, this wine has all the elements of dense fruit, intense acidity and rich tannins. The structure is dark and full of potential. With acidity at the end to give a lift of freshness, this is a wine for the long-term. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Renard Mondesir 2012  Fronsac
description: Owner Xavier Chassagnoux bought this estate in 1978, producing this as the top wine of the property. It shows the richness and fruitiness of the vintage, a ripe wine with black-plum fruit and touches of wood aging as well as crisp acidity at the end. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Renard Mondesir 2012  Fronsac
description: Owner Xavier Chassagnoux bought this estate in 1978, producing this as the top wine of the property. It shows the richness and fruitiness of the vintage, a ripe wine with black-plum fruit and touches of wood aging as well as crisp acidity at the end. Drink from 2018.

title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Touriga Nacional-Merlot-Syrah Red (Tejo)
description: This is a dark- colored, smoothly ripe wine. With wood spice and with plenty of blackberry fruitiness, it's both structured and generous. The acidity it gets from the Touriga Nacional in the blend gives it a crisp aftertaste and the possibility of further aging. Drink now or from 2018.

title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2011 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: Always a popular vineyard, Beaune Grèves has produces a full, ripe, intense wine. It shows some signs of wood aging as well as rich strawberry and red plum. It's delicious already, but this full and complex wine deserves aging. Drink now –2025.

title: Herdade Grande 2013 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)
description: Very light wood aging gives a complex dimension without losing the ripe yellow fruits that give the wine its rich character. Fresher acidity is integrating well with the spice and vanilla. Drink in 2016.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Pegos Claros Grand Escolha Castelão (Península de Setúbal)
description: A big, bold and ripe wine, this is rich and packed with dark fruits. Firm tannins are well cushioned by the berry fruits and the acidity. It is a generous wine that comes from the region south of Lisbon. Aged in wood for 12 months, it is now ready to drink.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2010 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)
description: This is rich and ripe, with just a touch of wood influence. It has a tropical fruit and lime flavor, with lemon zest acidity. It is full, very structured and mineral, adding the complexity of ripe fruit. Age for 3–4 years.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Quinta do Gradil Red (Lisboa)
description: This concentrated wine is dense with black fruits. Dark with chocolate and richness, it is still young and firm. Wood aging has smoothed the tannins and given extra fullness. The smoky aftertaste promises well. Drink from 2018.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Quinta do Gradil Red (Lisboa)
description: This concentrated wine is dense with black fruits. Dark with chocolate and richness, it is still young and firm. Wood aging has smoothed the tannins and given extra fullness. The smoky aftertaste promises well. Drink from 2018.

title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2011 Dona Maria Grande Reserva Red (Alentejo)
description: This rich and powerful wine offers dark tannins, great concentration and bold black fruits. Wood aging has added both spice and a smooth texture. The wine comes from a good vintage and although it is ready to drink will repay aging; drink now and until 2023.

title: Véronique Günther-Chereau 2016 Château de la Gravelle Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This fruity wine is ripe with crisp red apples. It has acidity as well as a touch of pepper, although the main thrust of the wine is the rich fruitiness and rounded texture at the end. Drink now.

title: Château Plince 2014  Pomerol
description: The wine has bold fruit and ripe tannins. There is still a strong flavor from the wood aging although this should integrate. The fruit is the dominant character of this red-berry flavored wine. Drink from 2021.

title: Maison Givas 2014 Vin No 1  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)
description: The wine is seriously structured for the vintage: that means a wine that is full of tannins, dark and firm. It has concentration and black fruits, shot through with acidity. Drink this dense wine from 2018.

title: Château Haut-Gelineau 2011  Côtes de Bourg
description: The wine does have fruit, but it is masked by strong burnt tannins from the wood aging. The acidity shows the possibility of red berry fruits appearing later.

title: Vignobles Brumont 2009 Château Bouscassé Menhir Red (Madiran)
description: Named after the stone blocks or menhirs which are a part of the Tannat vineyard, this a ripe, open and fruity wine. The Merlot does its job of softening the firm tannins of the Tannat and the blend gives a generous wine that has hints of the wood aging along with spice and acidity. Drink now.

title: Fonseca 2008 Quinta do Panascal Vintage  (Port)
description: Fruity, big, ripe wine, its tannins enveloped in the ripe forward fruit. There is sweetness here from black figs and berries, while red berries give acidity. Will it age? Yes, there are tannins to put it on the long road.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Ramos Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a dark and dense wine, serious with its firm tannins and solid black fruits. It has spice, blackberry and currant flavors, along with a pure line of acidity. With its firm structure, this dry, concentrated wine needs to age. Drink from 2015.

title: Sacha Lichine 2013 SLS Blend No. 8 Red (Vin de France)
description: Very soft, not quite dry, this red wine is ripe and full. It has a gentle structure with some stalky black fruits and ripe tannins. It's very ready to drink.

title: Château Bois de Rolland 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: A ripe and fruity wine, very typical of the vintage. There's a strong stalky black currant character, with some dry tannins and wood flavors. The aftertaste, though, comes right back to fruit and juicy acidity.

title: Exem 2011  Bordeaux
description: A forward, fruity red, coming through strongly on black currant, red fruits and soft tannins. It shows its wood aging easily, leaving an aftertaste that has light acidity. Drink now and until 2019.

title: Domaine les Pins 2011 Le Clos Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)
description: A structured wine with tannins from wood aging, as well as rich blackberry fruit. The wine has fruit and structural intensity, layering spice and juiciness atop a dry core. Keep for 3–5 years.

title: Gebeshuber 2011 Grosse Reserve Red (Thermenregion)
description: A wood-aged blend of Pinot Noir and Saint Laurent, this is a ripe, smooth, perfumed wine. It has juicy red fruits laced with acidity, toast and a firm structure of fruit tannins. Give this wine at least three years to develop. Screwcap.

title: Clos Teddi 2016 Rosé (Patrimonio)
description: Soft and full of red fruit, with balanced acidity, this is a rich style of rosé. Its generous texture has a crisp edge that lifts its full, creamy character. Drink now.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Reserva White (Douro)
description: With strong wood-aging flavors, this is a full, very ripe and concentrated wine. Coming from old vines, it has depth of flavor, both fruity and rich. Peach and pear flavors dominate, along with spice from wood aging. The wine needs some aging, so drink from 2015.

title: Casa da Passarella 2011 Enxertia Alfrocheiro (Dão)
description: One of the Dão's local grapes, Alfrocheiro gives this ripe, smooth and juicy fruit. The essential mineral tannins of the region are ameliorated by the rich berry flavors and great acidity. This wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2016.

title: Château Gaillard 2014  Beaujolais-Villages
description: This wine is rich and full in the mouth, with swathes of ripe plum and cherry fruits. To balance that, a firm layer of tannins points up the ripe, juicy and rounded fruits of 100% Gamay. Drink this impressive wine now. It's produced by father and son, Michel and Sébastien Gutty, in Morgon.

title: Bernard Magrez 2012 La Sérénité des Grands Chênes  (Médoc)
description: The 45% Cabernet Sauvignon in this wine gives it structure and aging potential. It is a ripe wine that is also stylish with attractive acidity and plenty of black-currant fruitiness. The wine is developing well and it should be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Bernard Magrez 2012 La Sérénité des Grands Chênes  (Médoc)
description: The 45% Cabernet Sauvignon in this wine gives it structure and aging potential. It is a ripe wine that is also stylish with attractive acidity and plenty of black-currant fruitiness. The wine is developing well and it should be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Château Eugénie 2015 Tradition Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: Here is a ripe wine from a fine vintage in Cahors. With touches of spice as well as rich black-currant fruits, the wine is all about its fruitiness and acidity—ably assisted by tannins. The aftertaste just keeps the fruit coming.

title: Chateau Brisson 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Packed with wood and fruit, this rich wine needs time. A juicy blend of 85% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, it's full of attractive acidity and blackberry fruits. The tannins do need to soften and round out, so drink from 2017.

title: Maison Bouey 2015 Bordeaux By Boyd-Cantenac  (Bordeaux)
description: A solid wine with firm tannins, this has structure as well as black-currant acidity. It still has a dry core although this will certainly soften over the next few months. It has the potential to be a ripe fruity wine from early 2018.

title: Herdade dos Machados 2011 Toutalga Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a full-bodied and very ripe wine. It is dry, but has layers of sweet fruits, gentle tannins and suggestions of the wood aging. With spice, some herbal character and great fruitiness, it's ready to drink.

title: Château de Lescours 2012  Saint-Émilion
description: This is a firm wine with solid tannins as well as layers of juicy black currant and cherry fruits. Acidity and a good sense of structure are still developing, meaning the wine needs to age longer. Drink from 2018.

title: Château de Lescours 2012  Saint-Émilion
description: This is a firm wine with solid tannins as well as layers of juicy black currant and cherry fruits. Acidity and a good sense of structure are still developing, meaning the wine needs to age longer. Drink from 2018.

title: Vollereaux 2009 Brut Tradition Millésime  (Champagne)
description: This is a rich wine that's full of crisp fruit notes, with a touch of minerality. Ripe yellow fruits and melon come to the fore, balanced by the attractive acidity and tangy aftertaste. It is ready to drink.

title: Quevedo 2011 Cláudia's Reserve Red (Douro)
description: A ripe, tannic and herbal wine, this has been produced for aging. It shows a dark tannic side over the juicy black plum fruits and berry flavors. The wood aging shows in the way the wine smoothes out at the end, leaving a rich, full-bodied aftertaste. Drink from 2016.

title: CARM 2005 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: A fine, ripe wine, very elegant, with its red plum and berry fruits rounded out with smooth wood flavors. The tannins, obviously here, are in a supporting role to this delicious fruit. And the aftertaste is long, rounded and soft.

title: Chateau de Pibarnon 2008 Red (Bandol)
description: This is an elegant and stylish wine that's full of lively acidity, red berry fruitiness and soft tannins. The wine is well integrated, with just a touch of gaminess and bright acidity on the finish. It is ready to drink.

title: Chateau de Pibarnon 2008 Red (Bandol)
description: This is an elegant and stylish wine that's full of lively acidity, red berry fruitiness and soft tannins. The wine is well integrated, with just a touch of gaminess and bright acidity on the finish. It is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Pral 2008 Les Charmes  (Morgon)
description: A finely structured wine, very firm, with a dark edge of tannins over ripe black fruit. The wine is concentrated and dense, still developing and showing great final juicy character.

title: Barton & Guestier 2016 Bistro Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This ripe, cherry-flavored wine has touches of toasty spice from wood aging. It's smooth and soft, with juicy acidity that offsets its rounded texture.

title: Château de Belcier 2012 Château de Monrecueil  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This is a perfumed wine full of attractive black currant and spice flavors. The wood aging has given a great fillip of richness to the stalky fruit as well as rounding it out. It could age further, so drink from 2017.

title: Château de Belcier 2012 Château de Monrecueil  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This is a perfumed wine full of attractive black currant and spice flavors. The wood aging has given a great fillip of richness to the stalky fruit as well as rounding it out. It could age further, so drink from 2017.

title: Henri Schoenheitz 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: This soft, rounded wine has gentle ripe fruit flavors while missing out on acidity. It's medium sweet, warm with spice and a rich, full-bodied aftertaste. Drink now.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Casa do Lago Grande Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: A wine that emphasizes the black currant acidity and firm tannins of Cabernet Sauvignon. The fruit layers acidity, wood and some herbs. Age for another year.

title: Domaine du Théron 2014 Malbec (Cahors)
description: An immediately attractive wine that is bursting with black currant fruitiness. Along with light tannins and red berry fruits, it is fresh without any hint of wood aging. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Château Haut Pasquet 2015  Bordeaux
description: This attractive fruity wine is full of young black-currant and red-berry fruits. The tannins mingle with spice to give a contrast to the aura of fruitiness surrounding the wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Louis Max 2016  Mâcon-Villages
description: This tangy, ripe and fruity wine is crisp with acidity. It's attractively brimming with fruit and ready to drink.

title: Poças 2015 Coroa d'Ouro Red (Douro)
description: This lightly wood-aged wine is ripe in red-berry flavors. It is well structured, its tannins integrated into a broad, soft texture. Acidity and fruitiness dominate the finish.

title: Château Fonplégade 2006  Saint-Émilion
description: Great wafts of sweet fruit and ripe tannins show this wine well. Its fruit is balanced, the power behind it well judged alongside the fresh juicy black currant flavors and acidity. The texture is certainly dense, and the wine needs time. Give it 4–5 years.

title: Château les Valentines 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Obviously a wine to drink on February 14, this is brightly fruity and crisp while showing some good dense flavors. Red fruits push through the citrus and grapefruit acidity to give a full-bodied, ripe wine.

title: Château Laubès 2010  Bordeaux
description: This is a wine that is almost mature. With generous black fruits and tannins that are integrated into the texture, the wine is ripe and fruity. The acidity is still there, giving a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Laubès 2010  Bordeaux
description: This is a wine that is almost mature. With generous black fruits and tannins that are integrated into the texture, the wine is ripe and fruity. The acidity is still there, giving a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Mayne Vieil 2011 Cuvée Aliénor  (Fronsac)
description: Spice and ripe fruit, with attractive tannins and a soft texture. This wine is open, generous, rich and packed with black currant fruitiness. Give this wine another 2–4 years, but it could well be drinkable sooner.

title: Domaine de Cause 2012 La Lande Cavagnac Malbec (Cahors)
description: Produced from the old vines of one of Cahor's emblematic estates, this is a dark, dense and concentrated wine. Full of black plum skins that are balanced with acidity, it is rich with black cherry and a smoky character from the wood aging. This 100% Malbec does need aging and should be drunk from 2019.

title: Château Fantou 2012 L'Enclos des Graves Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: This spicy wine with its aromatic character is fruity while also having some structure. The 90% Malbec/10% Merlot blend has a dry core, juicy red currant fruits and considerable acidity. With only a minimum of wood aging, it is ready to drink.

title: Château Buisson-Redon 2013  Bordeaux
description: This 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Franc blend is very fruity and fresh, balancing dry tannins and attractive red fruit flavors. It is light, still tight with its structure. Drink from 2016.

title: Château Jolys 2009 Cuvée Pauline  (Jurançon Sec)
description: The vintage has given a rich wine, one that is still young. Over the wood notes are ripe yellow fruits, orange marmalade and intense acidity. Age this concentrated wine for 2–3 years.

title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2010 Les Puillets Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
description: This has a firm edge of tannins along with dense red fruits. It's structured and balanced, with the texture and acidity that suggest its aging potential. Give this 3–4 years.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Les Morgeots Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)
description: This dense wine is still very young. The fruit still needs to express itself in a wine that is broad and ripe. Give this rich wine, with its creamy texture and touches of spice from wood aging, until 2021.

title: Yohan Lardy 2014 Les Deschamps  (Chénas)
description: This structured, firm wine brings out tannins as well as rich fruits. Concentrated raspberry and ripe cherry flavors are cut with a fine balance of acidity. From a single vineyard, the wine needs some age, so drink from 2017.

title: Château de Costis 2011  Bordeaux
description: This is a full-bodied, structured wine full of ripe berry fruits, delicate acidity and soft tannins. There is a juicy element that offers freshness to balance the firm texture. Wait a year to drink this wine.

title: Château le Calvaire 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Some wood aging gives this wine its rich character. The tannins, black-currant fruits and good proportion (36%) of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend all contribute to the wine's structure and ripeness. Drink from 2018.

title: Lion des Aubrots 2014  Côtes de Bourg
description: Produced with organically grown grapes, the wine is firm, still tight and with ripe black fruits. It is full, structured with enough fruitiness to balance the tannins. As it ages, this wine will come together into a rich while fruity wine. Drink from late 2017.

title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2013 Grande Côte de la Vallée  (Sancerre)
description: This is a structured wine with layers of tannins as well as ripe red plum skin fruit flavors. It is a wine for aging, which would bring out a rich texture as well as intense acidity. It should not be drunk before 2017.

title: Herdade da Comporta 2010 Comporta Alicante Bouschet (Península de Setúbal)
description: The red-juice grape Alicante Bouschet gives a fine performance here. It has produced a firm, structured wine with fine tannins as well as generous black fruit. It comes from a hot year in the region, producing great ripe, sweet fruit as well as intense acidity. The wine is just now ready to drink and will still mature further, at least until 2022.

title: Herdade da Comporta 2010 Comporta Alicante Bouschet (Península de Setúbal)
description: The red-juice grape Alicante Bouschet gives a fine performance here. It has produced a firm, structured wine with fine tannins as well as generous black fruit. It comes from a hot year in the region, producing great ripe, sweet fruit as well as intense acidity. The wine is just now ready to drink and will still mature further, at least until 2022.

title: Fiuza 2014 Merlot (Tejo)
description: Red plum flavors are spiced with wood aging and enlivened by zesty acidity. It is a fruity, lightly structured wine showing rich fruit tones. Drink now.

title: Enoport 2014 Novo Mondo Red (Douro)
description: This is a ripe, fruit-forward wine. It has black currant and some attractive acidity. It seems to miss out on the structure and firm texture that would be expected from a Douro wine, so it is possible to drink now.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2014 Les Lavières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Grown on rocky subsoil, this ripe and fruity wine has good acidity and plenty of black-cherry fruit. A darker core of tannins gives the wine a rich texture. With open fruits and plenty of acidity, the wine is developing well. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Brillette 2011  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: Ripe, full in the mouth and with a smooth, already silky texture, this is a generous wine. Its ripe blackberry fruits are juicy, while the tannins are soft and cushioned by the ripe fruits. This is a wine that will develop well, so drink from 2016.

title: Château la Patache 2012  Pomerol
description: This is a big, bold and fruity wine, packed with ripe Merlot fruit. Juicy blackberry flavors have a fine shot of acidity and soft tannins. It's a warm wine that will age well over the medium-term. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Champ du Moulin 2015  Bordeaux
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is a ripe, easy and fruity wine. It has light tannins, juicy black-currant fruit and acidity. It is still young, showing off its fruitiness and will be ready to drink soon, from early 2017.

title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Château de Chamirey Clos l'Evêque Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
description: This Premier Cru vineyard is on a high point in the village. It has produced a rich fruity wine with great structure and dense tannins. Bold red fruits are dominant with the acidity in a supporting role. The wine is rich, full and needing to age. Drink this wine from 2018.

title: Château Marsau 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This special selection, tight-cropped from 30 acres of 100% Merlot, is ripe and rich. This is a smoky and fruity wine, in barrel for 14 months. It has ripe black fruits and rich, dense structure. Spice and toast balance the fruit, giving an impressive sense of generosity. Drink from 2017.

title: De Luze 2014 Cuvée Fashion  (Bordeaux)
description: This soft, ready-to-drink wine is all about black-currant fruitiness, with only the lightest of tannins. Juicy, fresh acidity finishes an attractive wine.

title: Château Rahoul 2014  Graves
description: Produced from vines an average of 24-years-old, the wine comes from an 86-acre vineyard to the south of Bordeaux. It is firm with tannins and with ripe, textured Merlot. There is a juicy character from the black-currant fruitiness. The wine with wood flavors needs to age. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Haut le Valette 2015 Cuvée Caractères  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: A ripe and spicy wine, this is structured with black-currant fruits and lively acidity. It is still very young: its exuberant fruitiness likely to calm as it matures. Give this ripe wine until 2019.

title: Château Haut le Valette 2015 Cuvée Caractères  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: A ripe and spicy wine, this is structured with black-currant fruits and lively acidity. It is still very young: its exuberant fruitiness likely to calm as it matures. Give this ripe wine until 2019.

title: Château Larose Perganson 2011  Haut-Médoc
description: Almost black in color, this is a solid, firm and ripe wine. It has a smooth wood character that is round and rich with black plum and berry fruit flavors. With its dark underlying texture, it will age, so drink from 2017.

title: Domaine de Grand Garant 2014 Le Vivier  (Fleurie)
description: With broad, ripe fruit this is a rich, generous wine. The acidity gives fresh support to the warm cherry and red plum fruits. Underneath, tannins offer a dry core to the wine, allowing it to age. Drink from 2016.

title: Château Garreau 2010 Cuvée Armande  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This perfumed wine from a great year is rich in both fruit and structure, solid with tannins as well as ripe fruit. It is still youthful, dense and powerful. Wait and drink from 2018.

title: Château la Révérence 2012  Saint-Émilion
description: A blend of 50/50 Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this is a rich, spicy and perfumed wine. Layers of wood aging accompany ripe blackberry fruits and dark tannins. The texture is dense and dark, still developing. Drink from 2018.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2012 Bridão Colheita Seleccionada Touriga Nacional (Tejo)
description: Big and fruity, this is a forward and fresh wine. It has all the weight of ripe Touriga Nacional, perfumed and rich with blackberry fruits. A soft tannic background gives structure to the immediately attractive acidity and fruitiness.

title: Hafner 2003 Kashmir Red (Burgenland)
description: Rich and soft, this is a fine blended wine that shows layers of wood, ripe tannins, flavors of blackberry fruits and good balancing acidity. There is a delicious juiciness from the St Laurent, which is tightened by the other grapes in the blend.

title: Domaine Huguenot 2014 Champ Perdrix  (Marsannay)
description: This wine is smoky, ripe and packed with tannins. The fruit gives the wine weight although it is not yet fully developed. There is a toasty background to this rich wine with its juicy red-berry fruits and acidity. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Huguenot 2014 Champ Perdrix  (Marsannay)
description: This wine is smoky, ripe and packed with tannins. The fruit gives the wine weight although it is not yet fully developed. There is a toasty background to this rich wine with its juicy red-berry fruits and acidity. Drink from 2019.

title: Château les Vieux Moulins 2014 Cuvée les Hélices  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This certified organic wine from Damien Lorteau is juicy with attractive blackberry fruit. Spice and warm tannins (aged 12 months in barrel) give it a rich structure. It will have a fine future—a ripe wine with plenty of fruitiness. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Labat 2013  Haut-Médoc
description: Run by the Nony family who also own Château Caronne Ste Gemme, this well-made wine has taken advantage of the fruitiness of the vintage. Ripe fruit is the hallmark here, juicy blackberry and soft tannins rounded by some wood aging. Drink from 2017.

title: Philippe Jeannot 2015 Clos des Hâtes  (Santenay)
description: Ten months of wood aging has given this wine richness and fine spiciness. It is rich while still textured with minerality and tight citrus flavors. With its juicy acidity, the wine will age. Drink from 2018.

title: Château du Cèdre 2012 Malbec (Cahors)
description: The estate wine of Château du Cèdre is structured, balanced and full of fruit. It has black currant freshness under its solid tannins and dry core, poised between the intensity of the fruit and the firm structure. It will certainly age, and will be best from 2018.

title: Château Haut Cormier 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This ripe but balanced wine has ripe wood aromas and a solid tannic structure. Its black currant fruitiness is still developing, promising future juiciness. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta da Rede 2014 Rede Colheita Tinto Red (Douro)
description: The wine shows its youth with firm, mineral tannins and only a light hint at the fruit. It does have plenty of acidity so it will develop a fresh, fruity character in a few months. The aftertaste is firm and still needing time. Drink from 2017.

title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Barão de Figueira Red (Beira Interior)
description: This wine from the mountain vineyards of eastern Portugal is rich, fruity and made to be drunk young. With soft tannins and juicy red berry fruit, it's open and ripe. Drink now.

title: Château Arnaucosse 2011  Bordeaux
description: A rich, smooth wine, all ripe black fruit and soft tannins. It has weight and depth, but is ready to drink now.

title: Conceito Vinhos 2012 Conceito Red (Douro)
description: This big and rich wine is succulent and generous. Firm tannins show strongly through the ripe juicy black currant fruits. Full of the strong minerality typical of the Douro, this wine and its dry core still needs time to age. Drink from 2018.

title: Conceito Vinhos 2012 Conceito Red (Douro)
description: This big and rich wine is succulent and generous. Firm tannins show strongly through the ripe juicy black currant fruits. Full of the strong minerality typical of the Douro, this wine and its dry core still needs time to age. Drink from 2018.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: A solid and textured wine, Catapereiro Reserva is full-bodied and rich. With dark berry and ripe plum fruit characteristics, as well as firm tannins, it is a serious and complex wine that deserves aging. Drink from 2015.

title: Obrigado 2015 Nortico Alvarinho (Minho)
description: A ripe, creamy wine with fine fruit and soft acidity, this is delicious wine to drink now. It has apple and ripe pear fruits along with bright acidity to keep it all fresh. The aftertaste is smooth with just a light tang.

title: Domaine de la Noblaie 2011 La Noblaie Rouge  (Chinon)
description: Firm, full-bodied wine, the estate wine of Domaine de la Noblaie is rich in its dried fruit, red berry and solid structure. While it is still young, the wine has weight and the definite potential to age.

title: Château Lagrave 2012 Le Second  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Firm and solidly structured, this is a dense wine. It has plenty of tannins and a touch of bitter chocolate, but they are supported by the ripe fruit and fresh black currant flavors. It's a wine for aging, drink from 2017.

title: Château Lagrave 2012 Le Second  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Firm and solidly structured, this is a dense wine. It has plenty of tannins and a touch of bitter chocolate, but they are supported by the ripe fruit and fresh black currant flavors. It's a wine for aging, drink from 2017.

title: Famille Laplace 2014 Domaine Mouréou Red (Madiran)
description: One of several properties owned by the Laplace family, this estate has produced a ripe, juicy and generously tannic wine. It has luscious acidity as well as bold black-currant fruit. With some dark tannins and a firm structure, it can age. Drink starting from 2018.

title: Domaine de l'Hermitage 2015 Les Pierres Chaudes  (Menetou-Salon)
description: This is a smooth wine with soft tannins cushioned by generous fruits. Its red-cherry acidity gives the lightest stalky edge and will allow the wine to age further. The partial barrel aging has added spice. Drink this fine wine from 2019.

title: Domaine de l'Hermitage 2015 Les Pierres Chaudes  (Menetou-Salon)
description: This is a smooth wine with soft tannins cushioned by generous fruits. Its red-cherry acidity gives the lightest stalky edge and will allow the wine to age further. The partial barrel aging has added spice. Drink this fine wine from 2019.

title: Château Peyros 2013 Vieilles Vignes Tannat-Cabernet (Madiran)
description: Vines up to 50-years-old are the basis of this rich and tannic wine. While it does have some age, it still has a way to go. Big bold tannins show strongly along with ripe black-plum skins. The wood aging has given this wine a smooth elegant edge that contrasts with the still young fruitiness. Drink from 2021.

title: Casa Santa Vitória 2015 Versátil Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: Made to be drunk young, this wine gives a burst of ripe red fruit. The tannins are soft and open, balanced with acidity. The aftertaste is smooth and generous. Drink now.

title: Ramos-Pinto 2013 Duas Quintas Reserva White (Douro)
description: While the aromas of this rich wine suggest a barnyard character, on the palate it is ripe and still young. Yellow fruits dominate with light acidity and a generous structure. At the end, the wine is full, opulent and needing to age. Drink from 2017.

title: Domaine des Terrisses 2012 Grande Tradition Red (Gaillac)
description: This is a broad, rich blend of Duras and Braucol with a little Syrah thrown in. It is ripe, with black fruits and balanced tannins that give structure but do not dominate. A smoky character from wood aging rounds it out. Drink from 2016.

title: Château Magnol 2008  Haut-Médoc
description: From Barton & Guestier's own chateau, the wine is a well-balanced spice- and berry fruit-flavored wine. Its tannins fit with the fresh 2008 acidity and lively, fruity character. Age for 2–3 years.

title: Château Maison Noble Saint Martin 2015 Château Jean de Bel Air  (Bordeaux)
description: A ripe perfumed wine with fine tannins as well as dense fruit. Blackberry flavors are up there along with the acidity and crisp aftertaste. It's a wine with a good future, ready to drink from 2018.

title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Villa Oliveira Branco Encruzado (Dão)
description: This rich, wood-aged wine is full of yellow fruits with a tight texture. Mineral driven, it's crisp with its apple acidity and bright, steely structure. It's so fresh now, but could age well to create a smooth, mellifluous wine from 2017.

title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Herdade da Farizoa Reserva Red (Alentejo)
description: This wine has all the richness and ripeness of the Alentejo. Packed with dense black fruits and balanced acidity, it is a blend of two perfumed grapes, Touriga Nacional and Syrah. The wood aging has rounded out the natural tannins of the fruit and given a concentrated wine that will still need to age. Drink from 2017.
